description:
I come to Louis' about once a month since I live a few blocks away. The wait to get in is crazy on weekends, but very quick during the week day mornings. Food is pretty consistent. You come here on a slow morning for the views. It is amazing and my only reason to really come back when i have time to eat a slow breakfast. 

Food:
I have only ever ordered breakfast. When we came in i had Greg's cheesy cheese plate with chili, pancakes, bacon, potatoes and English muffin. My gf had eggs Benedict, with an English muffin. The food was great, pancakes were exactly how you would want them, very fluffy and sweet with the added syrup. My chili plate was really good, but very very cheesy. Overall a solid breakfast.

Service:
As to be expected, we came in, seated quickly, ordered and it came out quick. It's breakfast food so not much need for a lot of additional things from the waiter except box and check. Overall good service

Pricing: 
Pretty pricy for breakfast food and service. You're paying for the view mostly.

Overall:
You would never catch me here on the weekend, but every once and awhile during the week I will stop in for breakfast. Great place with great views.
author: Robert R.

description:
A San Francisco Original!

Louis' Restaurant opened on Sunday, February 14, 1937, but there is a lot of Louis' history that pre and proceeded that Sunday, so I do encourage to read about it on their website if you have a couple of minutes.

The menu is what you might call a classic Diner menu, but the food is good. I have been there mostly for breakfast but also have tried their burgers and New Steak a couple of time and always walked out as happy as clam at high tide!  On this particular visit I had the Hamburger Patty and Eggs. Loved it! I might order it with French Fries next time. 

Our server was wonderful and the view is fantastic! 

The location of the restaurant is perfect if you enjoy a walk after your meal. You can drive down the hill to Ocean Beach, walk across the street to Sutro Heights Park or walk down the side of the hill to walk around the ruins of Sutro Bath. Have your smartphone or camera ready as there will be many great photo opportunities. This entire area is very scenic. 

Oh, and did I mention that the coffee is good too?!
author: Afshin A.

description:
Food was definitely sub par, but the view is stellar. I would've given the restaurant 3 stars but I was so turned off by one of the waitresses, I had to log into yelp and write a review. 

She didn't even serve me, but I've never observed and overheard such a toxic human being in my life. A woman asked for a pen because she was on the phone with an insurance company because he house burned down. As the woman walks away this waitress says "... okay... and?". This is just ONE example of the rudeness she displayed for the entire diner to witness. 

If you don't like your job... quit. Period. 
Not sure what her name is, she was a bit on the heavier side. I won't be coming back. Well... I'm in town for only a day. But that's beside the point!
author: Aaron P.

description:
Two stars for the view!

Watered down coffee. Disgruntled waiters. Questionable cleanliness.
 
I'm pretty sure I saw some fries drop on the counter and the waitress put them back on the plate.

I suggest passing up on this place and just bringing food to eat on the top of the sutro baths.
author: Stephen P.

description: I actually loved the tuna melt and chocolate cake I got. Was a little expensive though but tasted good and great view! They only take cash also!
author: Komal S.

description: Great view of SF Ocean Beach Area as you enjoy your breakfast, staff was very polite and attentive. I ordered the sausage & cheese omelette with a side of potatoes and toast. Reasonably priced and tasted really good !
author: Mike H.

description:
Nice place with nice view close to the Sutra baths

My wife and I shared the ham and turkey 

sandwich on sourdough bread with fries 

She got hot chocolate

 good place to stop and take a rest during a 

bike ride
author: B I.

description:
3 stars for beautiful view. 
Small, clean place. Cheap food. We ordered escalopes- about $18 per plate. Nothing special. Red clam chowder wasn't good.
author: Essa Y.

description:
So cute. Great location. Nice area to walk by.
The food was pretty good actually wouldn't say it was the best, but my minestrone was very flavorful and the sourdough was a great dipping piece. The wait was about 30 mins which was no problem due to the walking path that leads to the bottom of the rock and a view of the Golden Gate Bridge.

Will be back
author: Rachrelle R.

description:
Just for reference - this place is cash only. If you need a breather or down time, grab a coffee or tea and enjoy the view. 

Pros
* very beautiful view of Sutro Baths! They'll seat you in the next available window seat if you ask 
* the host was very friendly and attentive to us. 

Cons
* I'd have to agree with other Yelpers that the service is pretty terrible. 
* I didn't get my coffee until the end of my meal
* I ordered the clam chowder and it was bathed in tomato sauce. I feel like they serve it because if it were regular clam chowder, it wouldn't be tasty at all
* our server looked like he didn't like his job
author: Angella G.

description: Place is great, French dip was bigger in person than in photos. The bad reviews are wrong, great food, people and stunning views!
author: Dion C.

description:
Awesome views. The Sutro Baths and oceanfront views were pretty. But we lucked out...we saw, off in the distance, whales spouting and breaching.  Glorious to behold. What a way to enjoy our meal! Plus the service was great. Leslie was terrific. The weeknight we dined here, she was the sole waitress and host.  She was doing it all and very well. So personable.

The food however is basic diner fare, nothing fancy schmazy or innovative.  Not terrible though. However if you want fresh organic farm to fork cuisine...this ain't it.  The pricing was SF diner pricing, not outrageous.   Plus it was very clean inside.  Up to date decor. 

I had a cup of minestrone, that came with sourdough sandwich slices n butter, and a side salad. The Mister had fish n chips.  The soup was tasty.  The fish n fries tasted store bought, like I can pullout of the freezer n heat up at home...but I'm not at home, I'm at Luis' watching whales live and not on the Nature channel. Also during my visit, the unisex bathroom went kaput...they were sending folks to the Cliffhouse restaurant. I had to make that journey and come back during my meal.  Oh well...stuff happens. 

Family owned since 1937. Pretty neat!  Cash only but don't fret they have an ATM inside.
author: Lillian W.

description:
Thank you Tommy for your true hospitality today. :)
Louis' is a great place to go for a good meal with friendly staff. Louis' has some of the most amazing ocean/cliff views you'll find in San Francisco.
author: Madison S.

description: Love looking out the windows while eating the vegan veggie burger and fries. Would definitely appreciate more vegan options here, but it's still a great, low key place for a scenic bite.
author: D. B.

description:
Here I am overlooking a beautiful ocean...then I get this breakfast.
Bills special-flavor very consistent with a Sausage McMuffin. The side of potatoes is chopped steak fries that taste like they're microwaveable.
Great view-which is why 2 stars, but I can't believe I paid this much to eat here.
author: Matty C.

description:
Confirming with other reviews:

Service = horrible; reluctant to accommodate what California considers as a disabled person; but quite quick to smile & be pleasant when they see the size of the tips,
Food = "very" sub- par for the price they charge,
Views = great but compromised by the food & services,

Easy to find parking though...
author: Jesse F.

description: Service was great. Food was really  tasty. I had the eggs with bacon, the English muffin was good with the strawberry jelly. The food was just right, it Wasn't greasy or anything. There is also a nice view while you enjoy your food.
author: Maryanna G.

description:
View is amazing , food so so , manager is extremely rude and unfriendly 

It's a shame , coz the place otherwise would be great
author: JC A.

description:
Great view, friendly servers, and food wasn't bad. I'd recommend coming here for the experience and views rather than trying to have a super delicious meal. Although the salad was pretty sad, we definitely enjoyed our fries and root beer float.
The line was long as would be expected on a weekend, but we were seated in a reasonable amount of time. The place is pretty tiny so you'll see why it takes so long, plus larger parties will definitely be more of an issue. [Tip: if you are OK at the counter without having a view, you'll be seated a lot quicker]
The prices are reasonable, but they only accept CASH.
author: Anne G.

description: Very good food and even better service. Lots going on and very busy but great place for lunch. Got the turkey BLT and my wife got the chili. This one of the top places I've seen where the staff works together so well...extraordinary. Definitely would come back.
author: Justin H.

description:
The service was just awful (we have neen there around 2PM today (Dec 20th)). The waiters never smiled to us, they had such faces like I stole their money. I felt myself like I am somewhere in Eastern Europe (concerning the service). They did not deserve tips at all. However they never brought any change for us, we were waiting for quite a long time and they never came to bring us a change and they did it on purpose for sure. Finally we just left because we could not wait anymore and they forced us (but never coming to give is change) to leave them quite big tips, however, they never deserved it with their work. So the basically stole my money.

Food is just typical american food: sandwiches and burgers. No normal vegetables neither in menu nor served with a dish. It is so unhealthy to eat just meat and bread without even an option to order vegetables.
Such a wonderful location, they should have worked hard to spoil it with such an awful service. I am wondering why the owner of this place tolerates that.
author: Anna S.

description:
Definitely eat elsewhere before you come sight-seeing around this area. 

While the scenery and ocean views are easy on the eyes, the diner food here is average and expensive. I ordered a ham, cheese and mushroom omelette that was accompanied by a English muffin and potato. While the food satisfied my hunger that morning, none of it screamed " COME BACK AND EAT ME SOON AGAIN". The taste of the food didn't excite my taste buds and the presentation was boring. 

It irks me that a place would charge almost $25 for an orange juice and a breakfast entree and ONLY TAKE CASH. Who can get away with cash-only transactions these days? Doughnut shops, inexpensive pizza slice joints and very cheap hole-in-the-wall restaurants. Louis' has gotta get on with the times and accept credit cards if they are going to charge an arm and a leg for their restaurant scenic views.
author: Philip M.

description:
I've been to Louis' twice in my few years living in the Bay Area and I have to say that dining at this restaurant is one of those experiences you should try once in your life - especially if you enjoy comfort food and views.

A little background on Louis': this family owned restaurant has been here in the exact spot since 1937, when it opened on Valentine's Day. It overlooks Ocean Beach and Sutro Baths, once a famous bathhouse in the early 1900's until it burned down from a huge fire in 1966. Fun fact: there's a picture on the window at Louis' which shows what the bath house looked like back in the day!

The restaurant itself sells pure American food. From around morning til 2pm, you will have your assortment of brunch items that include popular items such as Eggs Benedict and pancakes. Afterwards you have lunch items ranging from sandwiches to burgers. 

The first time I arrived at Louis', both my friend and I were spellbound by the amazing experience you get at the restaurant. Most of you have probably heard about Cliff House, that high profile, super expensive restaurant overlooking Ocean Beach. Yep, that's right next door to Louis'. As an alternative, if you just want good views with decent food, Louis' is where it's at: the restaurant is small, but it's completely surrounded by windows overlooking the beach. Even though crowds can be huge (get here before noon), definitely wait until a spot opens up right next to the windows. The experience is WORTH THE WAIT. 

I highly recommend you come for the brunch. My friend and I made it in time to get their Eggs Benedict with a few pancakes on the side and I thought they were great! The food wasn't too pricey and the portion sizes are enough to satisfy you. I really enjoy the service was well; generally, family owned restaurants have amazing service and Louis' is no different. 

In contrast, I thought the lunch items could have been better. The second time I went to Louis', we got some clam chowder to split, my friend got the tuna melt, and I got the steak sandwich. First impressions overall was that the clam chowder was good (not too chunky and its red not white), the tuna melt was extraordinary, but the steak was pretty mediocre. The bread was a bit too hard and the steak needed more juice. That said, for the price you can't go wrong.

Overall, I would come to Louis' purely for the view. The food here is great, but it's not going to be Cliff House quality or some great brunch food. You'll be satisfied, but more often than not the feeling of being next to the water without paying $$ transcends the desire for amazing lunch. 

Eat well and prosper,
author: Bryan W.

description: Amazing views / Okay food.  We've been here 1/2 dozen times either for Sunday brunch or when we have visitors & we wanted to show a slightly different part of SF.  The view of the Sutro bath ruines are amazing. The food is standard diner fair so predictable.
author: Leung T.

description: It's unfortunate that upon entering Louis with my service dog the manager aggressively asked me what service my dog performed for me and in what context. When I answered her and showed her my dogs license, she said, "I didn't ask what was wrong with *you. I asked what service your dog performs?" I explained what service she performed two more times and was then asked to leave. The manager was testy and aggressive from the moment I entered the restaurant. I'm a pleasant person by nature, I probably would have stayed and still had dinner. She made asking about my dogs status an uncomfortable and unnecessarily challenging situation. She obviously needs more training in not only the law, but possibly in how to approach people in general.
author: Tamara S.

description: The food at Louis' is average.  They have basic traditional food for a much higher price than Denny's or IHOP.  A cup of coffee is $3.25!!! Insane! The reason they are able to charge so much is because of the great view of the ocean.  This is a cash only place so make sure you come with cash.  Customer service could definitely use some fine tuning.  I ordered the build your own scramble, and the quality was good and the food came out really fast.  The kitchen is definitely efficient and everything came out correctly.  I'd recommend this place for those who want to eat breakfast with a nice view of the ocean.  If that doesn't appeal to you, there are much better options through out the city.  Hope this is helpful!
author: Nestor C.

description: Location is everything--right here in the Golden Gate National Recreation Area! What a unique concessionaire with an 80+ year history. A five star view. Clean place, fast friendly service. Diner menu. We enjoyed Standard diner fare: BLT and cheeseburger with French fries and French dip with side salad. Side salad was awesome with beans and croutons and a couple cherry tomatoes. Sandwiches were okay--3 or 4 stars. Again it's location and history are worth making this a lunch stop. Breakfast menu looked extensive and is available all day. It is located at the Coastal Trail head near lands end visitor center. Cash only!!
author: Jill M.

description:
Took a buddy from out of town here. As many of you know this is a historic hotspot. Really dig the old school diner food. I would recommend getting a window spot it you can, the views are amazing.

BRING CASH - this place seems to be stuck in the past and DOES NOT accept credit cards. Little quirky but not a bit deal.
author: Austin R.

description:
So I haven't been here for almost a decade, and they've renovated since then (in 2011).  It looks great. 

Food = good. Is it the best food ever? No. Is it good diner food? Yes, and it fills a void that most of us crave but don't realize.

Eggs benedict (ham, they also have one with bacon or veggies, poached eggs and hollandaise over english muffin) served with potatoes = delicious and hearty portion.  The potatoes were perfectly cooked (no one wants soggy ones!) $14.50.

Omelette with bacon served with potatoes = $12.25

Chicken apple sausage = meh. Not sure but they tasted odd. Ended up leaving them. $5.95.  

Chili = meh. Says homemade but it tasted like canned chili. Served with sourdough bread and butter. The sourdough was awesome (Boudin's sour, soft and addicting.) Cup for $6.50. 

Coffee = $2.95 x2.

Prices = Breakfast for two came out to $48.93.

Service = friendly. :) They don't hustle you out but this place does fill up fast. And they will come around and refill your drinks. 

Views = epic. Pacific ocean views, sutro baths and lands end.  The corner booth in the back has the best view, but some people like the corner booth with the double windows (we prefer to see more view and less tourists lol)

If you can hit this place up before the lunch rush...then you're in luck, especially during the weekdays. 

Parking = street parking.  There is a lot nearby but we saw a ton of broken auto glass...so we didn't risk it. 

Support your local businesses.  Established in 1937.  Yes, 80 years!
author: Fannie S.

description:
If I could give this place no stars I would.  We live in Oakland and my niece was visiting for Spring Break.  This used to be my favorite little go to even though the service is...meh and the food is just ok.  My husband (who is white passing, stick with me here....it will all make sense) and I come here about once a month just to have a nice view of the ocean and enjoy a date.  
Let me back up...my oldest daughter visited with her girlfriend back in August, I took them here to show them the view and eat some chicken strips and fries, their favorite.  There were several tables available and we got seated in the far back corner (still a good view) but I asked if we could get the corner with two windows....and with a sigh, eye roll and reluctance we were moved.  I didn't want to believe that race played anything into this as my daughter and her girlfriend are both bi-racial (black).  
Fast forward to Sunday and all bets are off on whether this place is racist or not....they are! 
Remember my niece is visiting and my youngest daughter is with me...both bi-racial....
Here is the scene; its busy...think line out the door busy.  I drop the girls off to check in so I can go park. They call me to say that they can't add us to the list until the entire  party is there as well as an adult.  My niece is 20 and said she was an adult....this wasn't good enough, I run down after parking and we sign in to be seated, we are told it will be about ten minutes.  OK...we will wait.  A man walks in behind us and says how long is the wait for a party of four...15-20 minutes.  He says ok please add us...but there is only one person, no questions about his party or anything.  
A couple of minutes later three young white women walk in and ask how long the wait is....they are told "if you want to pull up one of these chairs (points to a row of empty seats where guests wait) you can sit at the end of this table here"....so they do.  My 15 year old daughter and 20 year old niece are shocked...upset and say..."did that just really happen"...I said, "it sure did...we can go."  My daughter says that she is hungry so we can stay but asks that we talk to the hostess privately.  So we are seated about fifteen minutes later....my daughter sits down and bursts into tears.  This is totally unlike her to be so emotional in public...I go into quiet mama bear mode and ask our server to send the hostess over before we order...who by the way took another guests drink order before taking ours even  though we were seated first....perhaps he was giving us space to console my daughter.  Anyhow, the hostess comes to our table...I tell her the situation I observed about all of the above, how it seemed racially motivated and she assures me that race never played a factor.  I pointed to my daughter several times and said..."you have a young teenage woman crying here because of what she perceived to be blatant racism"....you think you might want to apologize....she doesn't, she just keeps saying that we were waiting and she gave us a good table because of the wait....which I call BS...she kept saying that we asked for a booth....which we didn't....eventually she apologized to my daughter for making her sad.  We didn't order, we left!!! We will not be returning.
author: Mimi B.

description:
You come to Louis for the view- hands down. I had an omelette yesterday that was quite tasty. I got onion, mushroom, feta (they threw in spinach too- thank you!) The last few times I have been not overly impressed with the food but the view makes up for any missteps there- Overlooking the Sutro Baths and the Pacific Ocean? Ya count me in-
They accept cash only but have an ATM if you forget to bring some with you!
author: Tiffany S.

description:
The location for this place is amazing! Right next to Ocean Beach, overlooking what the old baths. Location is 10/10. 

Sadly the service is pretty poor and the food is super average for a premium price. My water didn't get refilled once, and I asked for my burger medium and it came pretty raw. 

I'd only come back because of the spectacular view, but you can forget the food.
author: Lilly H.

description: One of a kind diner overlooking Pacific Ocean from the top of the cliff. Here is where the hearty and hot meal served to those coming from land or sea:). Casual yet authentic place. Came here for  breakfast and had cooked to perfection veggie Benedict and pancakes. Thank you!
author: Ally M.

description: I'm reading through the more current reviews from late 2017 and 2018 and always wonder what's going on when they are on opposite sides of the spectrum going from 1 star to 4 or 5 stars.  Also, after reading so many really awful, I'm thinking:  What happened? For decades Louis' has been one of my favorite places to bring visitors for  1. the views; 2. the food and 3. the staff.  Did they get a new Manager?  Did they get a different chef causing the food quality to drop?  Did the staff change and now they're rude? I've never had a bad experience there.
author: Bree B.

description: Ducked in to this cash only diner on an excursion to Lands End and Cliff House. Staff seemed to be in their own time despite a constant line of potential customers. Food was good and portions were significant, just wanted a little more attention to the details to keep the rhythm of a dining experience (and yes, I know it's just a diner, but still...)
author: Eric W.

description:
My wife and I came to Louis' for dinner recently while we were staying at hotel up the street.  I ordered the 1/3 pound cheeseburger with fries and my wife ordered a bowl of the Coney Island Clam Chowder.  Also, we both ordered Anchor Steam beers.

I have to say that I was very disappointed by the overall quality of my food.  My cheeseburger was made from ingredients which were substandard in my opinion for what I had expected for a place such as this.  I have had a far better tasting burger at a fast food joint.  

When I tasted my wife's soup, I understood why she felt underwhelmed by the overall flavor and freshness of the soup as it seemed to us that the soup was likely warmed up on the stove from a can rather than made on the premises by a chef.

I realize that Louis' has a rich history with many years of service in this location.  Unfortunately, their food quality has fallen short for my personal taste and sadly, I will not be returning to this restaurant in the future.

My first review has removed due to my lack of expressing my visit in detail.  My hope is that this review helps the owners and management to understand that there is a freshness and flavor issue with regards to my visit to your establishment.

So in conclusion, yes it is true that Louis' has a lot of history and that is cool BUT the food is not very good from my viewpoint.  Sorry guys but the truth is the truth.  I sincerely hope my review helps in some small way.
author: John M.

description: We came upon this gem during our walk by Sutro Baths. We were seated right away and had a beautiful view of the ocean. I got the fish and chips with clam chowder and washed it down with a strawberry milkshake. Totally hit the spot with friendly service and a restaurant with an interesting history (details on the menu).
author: Lena Y.

description: This place is a must visit.  Good food, friendly service, great view of the coast.  I stop here every time I'm in SF.  Spoiler alert- no Coke, just Pepsi, and they only take cash.
author: 3 G.

description:
The view is great! the food is no bueno! the customer services is worse than the food they serve.

My family and i won't be coming back.
author: Luis T.

description: Been going here for years, took many people here, friends visiting, etc. they have the best hot chocolate & I love their eggs Benedict. Everything I've tried here was good. Prompted to give 2 stars because of their poor customer service every time I'm here. I noticed the waitresses are always just talking amongst themselves that they fail to pay attention to tables. Today, I waited 20 mins for someone to take my order (they haven't even given us any water at this point)-- nobody came so I approached one waitress to let her know we were ready to order. She told me she would send a waitress over & still nobody came. (There were about 3 people on the floor during this time & it wasn't a busy morning either) A waitress came and took the order of the table beside us but failed to come back to take ours so I approached the cashier & asked if I could just place my order there. She said she couldn't take orders so I mentioned that nobody has come to do so & returned to my table. Waited another 5 mins for nothing. My roommate this time approached one of the waitresses at the bar just to be RUDELY cut off and told "the waitress would be right there!" Pointing at the single waitress waiting tables and said "she's just finishing up she'll be right there!" as if so irritated that we wanted our orders placed. I was shocked at how rude these girls were being. If I wanted to talk to a bitch I wouldn't have gone to a restaurant. When there were 3 waitresses just hanging around by the bar while only 1 taking all the orders, I'm not sure why they couldn't take our order much less ask us if we wanted a drink within 30 mins of being there was beyond me. Stood up & left feeling so disappointed after that.
author: Timmi C.

description: Such a cute little dive bar right on the edge of SF. It's pretty cool to sit next to Sutro Baths on a n early sunday morning and not feel like you have to pay the premium price for breakfast/brunch in the city. They have classic breakfast here, but all of the food is very hearty and you can tell that it is made with a lot of care. The staff is AMAZING and I overheard that there are three generations of women working there! Wow!! You don't hear that everyday in SF, which is a pretty amazing feat to say the least :)
author: Micah L.

description: Very good service, beautiful view from anywhere within the restaurant of the San Francisco coastline, decent priced meal!
author: Robert J.

description: Two stars for the view. I ordered the scallops  and they were miniature scallops breaded and fried to look the size of a scallop. They seems like they came frozen in a box. The entire meal of scallops would add up to ONE full sized scallop that you would see in most restaurants in San Francisco! The scallops were about 1/4 inch across. I was very disappointed and felt ripped off.
author: Michele P.

description:
The fifth star is for the world-class view of the Pacific ocean, Ocean Beach, and the seal rocks.

Otherwise, this is a family run (75 years, Louis and Helen Hontalas first opened for business on Valentines Day in 1937) retro old-time restaurant specializing in breakfast, lunch, brunch, and dinner (open everyday from 6:30 A.M. to 9:00 P.M).

Their omelets are wonderful, mine stuffed with chicken apple sausage and cheddar. 

The service is big-smile efficient. The vibe is very nice. Go early, by 8, or you might have to wait. Park across the street, and don't leave valuables in your car--you know why.

Enjoy!
author: Reyn J.

description:
This is an absolutely pure Greek coffee shop. And I say that reverently. Delighted to find this place in food-obsessed San Francisco.  I immediately ordered a bowl of chili with a grilled American cheese deluxe.  Everything was perfect. Best GAC I've had in town. 

Looking forward to returning for more classics: omelettes, the 1/2 lb patty melt, a turkey club, etc.  

Yes, the views are stunning from every seat. Louis' is great!
author: Lee P.

description: Had lunch here with a friend. After arriving at 11:30 am, we were seated very quickly and ordered two Anchor Steam beers and a hamburger on french bread and fish and chips. Ehh..., as you can see from the pictures. I know this place is a San Francisco landmark, but the food and menu are "limited." Old school kind of diner, wonderful views of the Pacific. No credit cards accepted, only cash. Everything was fine, it just wasn't great. Food was very plain. Basic food for sustenance. I want more than a great view. Ehh...
author: Norm D.

description:
A nice breakfast at Louis' started a wonderful day.
The hamburger patty and eggs were just perfect! We were quickly seated after 20 minutes wait.  The wait staff was very attentive and the scenery outside the window was spectacular.
author: Wing W.

description: Out hiking with a friend today and came up .41 cents short today vs a $30 lunch tab.  Guy told me I would have to leave my ID with him and walk to get .41 cents somewhere.  A friend made a 30 minute bus ride to deliver 2 quarters.  Ridiculous!  If it matters at all to you, "Louis", you just lost a couple of loyal customers.
author: Cynthia H.

description: Born and raised in SF and just tried this place for the first time. Cute and quaint spot overlooking the ocean and parts of the Lands End trail. Small dining area and even smaller waiting area. Ordered the grilled hot dog and was throughly unimpressed. Yes, it's just a simple hot dog but the bread was ridiculous...it came on a French roll that was very tough and chewy, making each bite a game of tug-of-war. Not only was the bread thick and tough, it comprised of approximately 80% of the entire hot dog "sandwich". I had so many bites of just plain bread and eventually just gave up and ate the hot dog by itself with my side of fries. It was definitely not worth the $11.
author: A Y.

description:
My son and I dropped in after out Land's End hike.  He ordered he hot dog and I a salad with bay shrimp.  The hot dog came with a huge sour dough roll cut in half and extremely hard (difficult for a 5 year old to eat). The French fries were cooked on the surface of the sun but best of all, my salad had a fly.  When I informed the waitress, she giggled and said she'd let the kitchen know.  That was it.  No 1/2 off or free drink or anything.  A FLY in my food.  Just Gross. 
Don't think we'll be going back 
NOTE to Tourists - enjoy there view at the lookout - but get your meal elsewhere!

ps. Still suspicious of cash only....
author: Marcia K.

description:
Service isn't the greatest. The host was obviously pretty annoyed with our party of 10 but as someone who has been a waitress in a small and popular restaurant I can totally understand. Although,if a customer smiled at me and said thank you I'd at least give a smile back albeit a fake one haha
Other than that the food was awesome! My kids shared a pancake which was really good. 
My husband and I also shared the Louis' Eggs Benedict (eggs Benedict with bacon) and a bacon cheeseburger. The potatoes that came with breakfast were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Just add some salt and pepper and you're good to go! Loved the Benedict and the burger was tasty too. 
It's a great view and I appreciated the no fuss menu. So often now we are bombarded with all these special combinations of flavors. Although it is nice to be adventurous I enjoyed the simplicity of Louis' menu. It was also very nice to take the little hike after eating to walk off all those calories.
author: Lena S.

description: I have been going to restaurant every week. I have been to many different cities. This is by far the worst restaurant I have ever been. I went there when I had a toddler child. After one hour we were still waiting for the food so our child started to cry because she was hungry.  We calmed her down but the manager and waiter asked us to leave. I told her we have waited for 1 hour to eat and if we get our food to go we have no where to sit and eat so if you ask us to leave we would like to cancel our order. However, the manager threaten us to call the police over 3 sandwiches. I told her ok since I have brought guest to your restaurant I will just pay you the money. We left our food there and didn't take it. The manager extorted the money out of us because we the made mistake of coming in her restaurant.
author: Hana I.

description: We went to this place because a server at the restaurant where we had dinner the night before recommended it. He said that the food was good and had an amazing view.  And boy was be right.  We went on a Sunday for brunch. The place is really small. We waited like 15 minutes for a table by the window, so thats not too bad. The food was good. I had a bacon cheeseburger and honestly the flavor on the burger was amazing. I was a bit disappointed that they only served French toast and pancakes till 12. But oh well.  We got there at 2pm so guess it was time for me to eat a heavier meal. The service was great, everyone was so nice. Food was great, view was amazing.  A must check out.
author: Raschell R.

description: Classic Diner Fare; however, the views were great and the history behind the place was very interesting.
author: Matthew G.

description:
The view is the main attraction here. For the most part, the food is mediocre at best and your safest strategy is to order standard breakfast fare like pancakes. 

Now, back to that breathtaking view of Seal Rock, Sutro Baths and out to the vast expanses of the sea. So if you don't want to splurge on the nearby Cliff House but want to get some views worth contemplating, this place will fit the bill.
author: Carole B.

description: Friendly and welcoming!! The service was great and the classic eggs benedict hit the spot. The ham was sliced thin and the hollandaise was better than most. The hometown local feel of this place makes it worth the stop. Don't expect farm-to-table brags or artisanal bougieness. It's straight-up, no-frills goodness. The ladies workin' this joint are real solid, kind folks. Seems that way, anyway, and when it comes with perfectly poached eggs and an historic view most people never get to see in their lifetime, I'll take it any day!
author: Emily C.

description: Best classic tuna melt! Bread was grilled and buttery, cheddar cheese fully melted and tuna salad delicious. View is great to boot. It's small and cash only but there is an ATM onsite. The French dip and Eggs Benedict looked great. So glad I popped in.
author: Ana C.

description: Not what it use to be.. I would skip it if i had another place to go. Cash Only, ....There are so much better in sF
author: Ed A.

description: Views are top notch and cannot be beat. Breakfast is mediocre at best. Go for the views, or better yet, go hike around Lands End.
author: Kristina D.

description: Great views and great location. Food is good but very basic. Don't expect anything out of the ordinary. Basic breakfasts. The view is what saves this place.
author: Sergio L.

description: This place is cozy and affordable. The food was AMAZING! We had the French dip with fries. Probably the best one I've had so far. It's a cozy little diner with a beautiful view
author: Laura D.

description: The view from most tables is very interesting, you can see both the ocean and the ruins of the Sutro Baths. Our waiter was attentive and efficient, he even brewed a fresh pot of decaf coffee for us. The guys ordered cheeseburgers, I ordered a BLT. The food was crummy, bacon nearly burned and cold, the lettuce and tomato on stale toasted bread. Too bad cause it has so much potential- and be warned-cash only! Who does that anymore?
author: Marie B.

description: Great food and great view! Very good customer service and food always comes out fast, no matter how busy they are! Love this place!
author: Daria M.

description: Great view and location.  You would think that in 81 years in business they would know how to make great food but its not.  The hamburger steak was like rubber, prawns were fresh frozen warmed over, soup was full of macaroni and red stuff and some beans. I have lived in SF for 77 years and never tried this place but since cliff house restaurant was busy we said lets try it.  If it wasn't for the location and tourists this place would be long gone.
author: ed s.

description: I go there for a basic breakfast after a walk at lands end. If it is too busy, I skip. Mostly  I love the views and the coffee (they serve peerless).  Sometime i see whales or dolphins as I look out at the ocean from my table, on those rare occasions it goes to a 6-star experience for me ;). Service is usually friendly but often slow (especially on coffee refills), however as long as there is an amazing view,  good coffee and reasonably good service I will keep coming back.  They only accept cash, but there is an ATM.
author: AP P.

description: We've driven by Louis' a million times but never stopped.  We probably should have kept on driving but the views were spectacular so it was worth a visit once just for the scenery.  Unlike some other reviewers, we found the service to be very attentive and friendly, but the food wasn't very good.  If you're in the area, go to the Cliff House instead... better food and better views.
author: Nancy C.

description: The  customer service was awful at this place!  I was greeted with a rude glare and a harsh tone from the waitress .  She told me it would be a ten minute wait for a table , so I sat  patiently waiting near the door entrance  for availability.  After which,  a Caucasian  couple walked in and was  greeted with warm reception and was offered a corner table right away until a window seat was available. After which,  I requested my food to go because it was obvious they didn't want to serve me!
author: Valerie W.

description:
The views alone gets the 5 stars...but even if the view wasn't there, the service has always been great. Everyone working here is so nice and accommodating.

I've only done benedicts here and I really like them, they use a generous amount of ham and even the bacon benedict is good. The potatoes are nicely done. Decent coffee. It's the quintessential east coast diner that I miss so much!
author: Dorothygale T.

description:
Service 4 stars! 
View 10 stars!!!
But the food was a different story. 

My husband wanted to relive a childhood memory cause he had told our kids his Mom took him here when he was a child. He remembered looking out the window at the awesome Sutro bathes and thought that'd be cool to see our kids do the same. 

Onto the food. The food was subpar. French toast was made from plain sliced bread. Nothing special. My son ordered the fish and chips for $16.75. It looks to be from the store bought freezer not made in house(?) my hubby had the Benedict, ehhh. I didn't even bother trying it. I was eating w my eyes and it wasn't appealing. Breakfaat for 4 (w no drinks) was $59. This view doesn't come cheap.
author: Liz N.

description:
My mother and I went here for lunch after visiting the Legion of Honor. We also took a short walk around the former Sutro Baths area. 

Don't come here expecting a grand place, it is a diner. The view is marvelous though. 

My mother had the minestrone soup, and while it didn't look great, she said it was delicious. It came with some bread and butter. Unfortunately I didn't get a picture of it, but other reviews show pictures, and they are accurate. 

I had the French dip sandwich. I have a weakness for it, so when I see it on the menu at a restaurant I haven't been to before, I order it. This one was pretty good. In fact, I absolutely loved the bread. Thick and crusty and chewy, my favorite. The only thing that would have made it better would be some Swiss cheese. I would come here again just for the sandwich. The plate came with fries, but they were okay. If it wasn't so busy, I would have sent them back to be cooked a little more. They looked good, but weren't really crispy in the outside. 

All in all, I would come here again. The service was great, the food was good, and the view was marvelous.
author: Lisa K.

description:
An old school mom and pop diner that is so old school it is CASH ONLY. I was happy they had an ATM available for people such as myself who barely carry cash (the surcharge my bank charges not as nice). The servers were very friendly, welcoming, and warm and immediately found us an available table.

I ordered the waffles with the chicken tenders and unfortunately they didn't have anymore chicken tenders so instead I had a poached egg and bacon. The bacon was $5.25 and included a friendly portion of 6 strips. The poached egg was $2.95 and was perfectly poached to my liking- not too hard not too runny. My favorite was the way the maple syrup was served in tiny pitchers that made it look like maple syrup shots (too cute). There was also strawberry, apricot jams and grape jelly for the waffles. I chose strawberry which was perfect with the waffle. The waffle was $6.25, a large but flat, crisp, and buttery warm waffle so yummy with the strawberry jam and fresh maple syrup. It is important to note the waffle and some breakfast items are only available until 2PM! Luckily, we were there at about 11:30AM still prime brunch hours. 

Our meal was affordable, fresh, delicious, and served with a smile. Nothing else to ask for, plus the views were quite impressive. The way the sun hit the ocean was literally divine.
author: Astrid M.

description: On our last day in San Fran we knew we wanted to go see the Sutro Baths and Lands End Lookout. On our way our uber driver mentioned there was a really nice restaurant near there. Well we looked over at Louis' and loved how small and quaint it was. Like a little diner with an amazing view of the pacific! I ordered the bacon and cheddar omelette which came with an English muffin and some potato fries. So delicious! Totally worth it & not too expensive at all. However be sure to have cash because that's all they accept.
author: Carmen H.

description: I have never been here when. It's not busy. The prices are middle of the road and the food is Fabulous‼
author: Jamye Amy Z.

description: Despite the nice views, I would give this place a miss on account of the terrible service.. Head to Cliff House instead
author: Clara P.

description: The only reason why I'm giving this a 2 stars and not 1 star  is because of the view. Food taste like the store bought freezer foods . The servers are in a hurry all the time .  Felt to me like they are serving food to students on a cafeteria. Like here's your food now leave me alone.   If not for the view I'm sure this place would been close long time ago. I wish management will do something about it .
author: Nice C.

description:
Cash only!!

The food isn't really that good. Obviously a tourist attraction which is fine because on a clear day the views are EPIC! That's what you're really paying for. They have an ATM inside the restaurant which is nice because you may not always realize that a tourist attraction in 2015 is cash only.

The food was so bland. Nothing special. You can tell that everything comes from Costco. No originality and no flavor. The coffee was expensive and not great. You could tell the creamer they gave me for the coffee was really old. I ended up not even using it it looked so gross. 

So, given the food wasn't good I still really liked this place. We got the booth in the back and it was so nice just putting all electronic devices away and enjoying the view of nature. It was nice to just stop thinking for awhile and zoning out on the beauty.

So, I am glad we tried this place out but I don't think i'll be going back anytime soon.
author: Andy S.

description: I've eaten school lunches that were higher quality. The staff was nice and pleasant, however, the food was all cooked from frozen and my guess is all came from boxes. Also, newsflash: it's 2017 and they take cash only. They have satellite radio, but cannot take credit cards, BUT have an ATM. Ugh....The whole time we sat and ate lunch I couldn't help but think what the food must have been like back way back when....home cooked, from scratch, eat.  I'd love to see Gordon Ramsey turn this place around.
author: J B.

description: "You're paying for the view" isn't a new take on this old Frisco establishment, but it's the most succinct statement you can make at this place.
author: First Name L.

description: Quite the average brunch menu. There's nothing really special about it, but the view is really nice from the restaurant. The food is literally what the menu says, and does not add anything extra, so it is a little bit underwhelming overall. I ordered the eggs benedict, which was pretty good and as what you would expect out of any average eggs benedict. I'd say, it's a good place to stop before hiking the Lands End trail, otherwise, you might be better off eating at the cliff house or in the center of the city.
author: Michelle T.

description:
If you're looking for good food, this is not the place for you. You can get better food, for less at a chain like Denny's. It seems that people are willing to pay steep prices for less-than-mediocre food because of the good views, but I say skip the food and check out the views from the surrounding parks, hiking trails, beaches, or even parking lots- for free. Not all the tables will have views, and if they're busy you'll need to share tables with other groups. 

This place obviously knows that people are visiting for the views- not the food, ambiance, or service. They're coasting along strictly by their location and put no effort into the restaurant itself. 

My eggs benedict was bland, at best. Cash only.
author: Ashley H.

description:
That view! I could stare at her all day. The foaming tongue of waves, lapping at the shore. The storied stone and cement that gave structure to the old bath house. The sensuous curves of the shoreline where sand meets the ocean, dry meets wet, and "here" becomes "there." Indeed, you can't beat that view. 

Louis' is all about the location. 

As far as the food goes, well, the way I'm choosing to think of it is that you get what you pay for. In a city where food can be crazy expensive, my hat is off to Louis' for serving up simple fare for simple prices. Surely you could gut the place and hang all the Edison bulbs and industrial lighting with reclaimed wood tables and turn each table for hundreds of dollars each night. But these guys just keep doing what they've done for decades: serve us that simple food and keep it cheap.

The waffle is a waffle. Small grid. Circular iron. Batter poured in, served with a little butter and syrup. The eggs are eggs. I got an eggs and chili concoction with cheese, and it's just that: eggs, with cheese, covered in chili. The breakfast is diner food. The lunch is diner food. You're not paying any premium for locally sourced organic blah blah ingredients, and maybe only a slight premium for the real estate. But a few cents on a million dollar view is nothing.

This is old school charm. Like, cash only charm (who carries cash anymore?) and we don't exactly remodel very often charm. Park across the street, walk over, probably wait in line with tourists, and grab a bite. Bring your camera. That kind of view is a sexy that's only available in San Francisco.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
We enjoyed a late breakfast here while in the City, choosing it over Cliff House (pricey) and Beach Chalet (been there for dinner recently). The food is perfectly good diner quality food. We had our typical breakfast items, eggs, toast, potatoes, bacon, ham (formed, so not the best). Tab for two was $26. 

The service was great, polite and attentive start to finish. The view was phenomenal. Would come back, probably on a weekday like this time as I'm sure the weekends have quite a wait. We only had to wait 10 minutes for a window booth. 

Given the phenomenal view and a satisfying meal at a very reasonable price, we were happy with our choice!
author: Jan H.

description: Food was fine but the service and views are my favorite in San Francisco. Lovely overlook and pleasant staff makes this a must see destination. Cash only.
author: Kathy M.

description:
Love this place for it's simple burgers, sandwiches and milkshakes...I recommend visiting during the week to avoid the wait on weekends.
It's cash only, but they do have an ATM machine. The views of course are amazing!
author: Bogee B.

description: Decent food, spectacular view. The place is small and takes cash only. Good option if you're by the beach or Legion of Honor.
author: Bianca N.

description:
the view, the food, the service , 5stars. We had eggs ben & the tuna sandwich. It
Was really good. Loved the rye bread. Plus the fact that we were seated overlooking sutro baths, it was breathtaking for me. Surprised that this place doesn't garner much review. Would love to eat here again.
author: Carla C.

description: Wish I could give this place zero stars. I ordered the fried cod and it was exactly what you get in the box from the grocery store. The fish was hard and the batter was soggy from being fried while frozen together. This place has an unbelievable view of the ocean and they don't have fresh fish!! Did I mention it was $20 for three frozen fish sticks and crinkle cut fries. I agree with the guy that said it's ass vomit..
author: Tammy b.

description: I love this Litttle place, if you are in SF and want to eat a nice meal with an ocean view this is the place! The only drawback is the wait, be prepared to wait for a bit if you are trying to eat during their busy hours of the day. No matter how long the wait, the view and the food are totally worth it. The burgers are very tasty and so are the fish and chips. The dinner salads come with beans, which is a nice change from the norm.
author: Graham B.

description: Got lucky this morning as a big storm was coming into NorCal .... no waiting so we jump on the chance to just get a table and get a great breakfast !!!
author: Bobby M.

description:
Love this place. Get there early. Eat a diner breakfast. Enjoy amazing views. Bring cash. 

Anyone whining about the quality of the food doesn't understand what diner food is. It's not an art. It doesn't look good when instagrammed. It's food. Not every piece of french toast needs to be made out of heirloom brioche. Service was nice, coffee was diner coffee, and sure, everything was marked up a buck or two for the view, but HAVE YOU SEEN THE FREAKING VIEW!?! I'm just pleased this place is still around and hope it'll be there the next time I'm in the area.
author: Jake V.

description:
Incomparable level of rudeness! 

We were told to wait until everyone is inside the restaurant. When my sister arrive, she asked me and our friend why aren't we seated yet, we told her that everyone has to be here to be able for the wait staff to give us a table. She was annoyed but she rushed to the restroom. We were still waiting for our friends who has two kids. So when they finally arrived, they were shocked that the wait staff made us wait as if there's no available tables... There were only two tables occupied for heaven's sake! 

We were happy to dine at the Cliff House!
author: Lourdes E.

description:
Came here right after I finished the land's end hike.

Great venue with a view of the sutro baths and the pacific! The coffee is great and so is the pie (with ice cream) and the customer service. I totally recommend this place, especially on a cold day.
author: Tristin B.

description: We ordered cheese burger. It came with fries and salad. It was delicious. The owner was very nice. We sat by the window. The scene was excellent.
author: Am T.

description:
I was hoping after the remodel and reopen that this place would be better than it was before but it seems like they are currently skating by on their location per every other Coastal restaurant. Menu lacks any sort of creativity I believe a lot of food is Frozen or packaged.

Doing diner food can still be an art.... May as well put in a vending machine and a microwave at this location.
author: Jeremy R.

description: Each time I eat here everyone working is working diligently. Breakfast with a waffle that is made expertly is my usual selection. The cash requirement may catch some off guard. Considering the location, I don't mind paying a premium. Remember, parking is easy in the morning and free all day. That alone afords the price difference in San Francisco (the Financial District and Fisherman's Wharf can exceed $12 an hour). I enjoyed Land's End And the Sutro Baths after Ocean Beach. That's gotta be worth something. And, if you have ever worked for tips, you know cash is king. Friendly, helpful staff. Great view. Quick service. People are friendly here this time of year
author: The Adv G.

description: Small place, but the view makes it worth it.  Food ok - no complaints. You are going for the view and surrounding area.  Cash only.
author: D G.

description:
I stopped writing reviews on Yelp some time ago because [CENSORED, I don't want this review deleted] but this cash-only place clearly does not want your business and their go-away attitude is so egregiously bad that I had to say something. 

I think I was the first person to arrive around 6pm on the evening of June 22nd.Seeing the Cash Only sign in the window (argh), I am forced to drive to the ATM at the Safeway to avoid extortionate ATM fees. 

On my return, the place is empty save three or four other diners. The waitress must have either not wanted to wait on us because she couldn't be bothered and/or did not need the tip from our potential custom. When my brother arrives, but not our friend, we are then told that she will not seat us until everyone in our party has arrived. All three of us. Um, really? Seriously? When practically every single table in the entire restaurant is empty?? 

It may have been when I was in the bathroom that my brother says "Ok it's just two people," which caused her to accuse us of lying (which was technically true but when a place is empty who gives a shit whether not all members of a dining party are present?).

The place was unbearably stuffy (you're right by the ocean, ever think of opening a window?) so with our friend still en route we decided that we had had enough of her attitude and the lack of air and left, mocking her attitude on the way out, causing her to sigh and roll her eyes.

Oh and your cash-only thing is not retro-cute, it's just annoying. It's 2016.

In sum: We don't want your business. Go away. Which we did. We had really good Burmese food instead.
author: Mark G.

description:
NOTE: CASH ONLY

Come for the view, stay for the ... view.  That bumps this review to a rounding up from 3.5 instead of down.

Really, the view is pretty great - as others have very frequently commented.  The place itself looked small, so I imagine it gets pretty crowded.  The service is friendly and attentive.

The food itself is OK.  Nothing to write home about (though the chicken apple sausage is pretty decent).

But yeah, unbeatable views.
author: Jason H.

description:
Honestly, you just go to Lous' since there's nothing else in the area. Sure, the view is amazing (when it's not totally foggy), but the food is pretty lackluster

The waffle I got was this pretty sad thing that looked like it came from the freezer section, while my fiancee's burger was pretty frumpy looking. I'd avoid this place unless you're really hungry.
author: Casey S.

description: Diner with a beautiful view! Service was great, food was delicious, only reason for 4 stars is because I thought it was a little pricey for breakfast.
author: Brittany N.

description: Good American style food, friendly staff, and a great view. Definitely coming here again!
author: Anya R.

description: Everything at this place is average at best (variety on menu, food quality), except for its view of the Pacific Ocean and the Sutro Baths. The service also left a lot to be desired today. I came with my friend and her 3-year-old daughter, and not only was her child not offered a high seat when we saw other kids bigger than her getting them, but she also wasn't offered any coloring paper or crayons like the other kids were.
author: Yvonne W.

description: We like the food, and the waitress served us is super nice. Worth the waiting. Will come back.
author: Jackie Y.

description:
There was this really rich Duke, King or monk. He had these outdoor baths, you see. Then there was an earthquake or a fire, and now it's just ruins and a cave people like to check out below a decent diner. Fewf. Glad I remembered that story, and you're welcome for the history lesson. 

I've been to Louis' twice. It is cheap diner food that is slightly overpriced, but the views make it utterly worth it. On a sunny Saturday around hangover-brunch-o'clock there will be a lineup of tourists and locals scrambling to get their eggs in a corner booth with the view of a lifetime. (Look at the pics. I really can't put it into words.) Anyway, they open early and serve breakfast on weekdays, so there are times when you don't have to wait for the perfect view with some A-OK pancakes n' bacon. 

I think their Hollandaise sauce is from a package. Je ne care pas. It's tasty, and I get a side of it whenever I'm here. If you like a simple gooey egg sauce to go with your eggs, you should do this, too. 

PEPPER POINTS for the bathroom. It is a single toilet unisex that is bigger than most SF apartments.
author: Evelyn A.

description:
Came here after hearing great things about this place and seeing lines flowing out the door over the weekend.  Sadly outside of the amazing view overlooking the Pacific and the Sutro Baths this place has very little to offer.

We ordered fried prawns, a cup of the Coney Island clam chowder and a burger.  With the fried prawns the portion size was small with only 7 below average sized prawns.  The prawns had a good crunch on them but were not fresh. The burger was below average it tasted like the ground beef was not seasoned at all.

The best part of the meal was the Clam Chowder. It was seasoned well, not too salty and not overpowered by the acid of the tomato base which are common problems in a lot of Manhatten style clam chowders.  While the base was good, like the prawns the seafood in it was not fresh.

The place is cash only which is unacceptable for a sit down restaurant in silicon valley in 2016.  If I can buy fresh produce at a farmers market with my credit card then there is no excuse for why I shouldn't be able to do the same here.

To me this place is nothing more than a below average diner that has a great location.  They exploit the view they can offer by serving small portions of below average food at an insane markup.
author: Steve M.

description: The view is fine whether you're in louis' or outside.  I totally agree that the food is just ok.  Nothing fancy, but holy cow it was expensive for a place like this with the mediocre food.  Wow.  I'm also going to agree with the others on customer service.  No refills, no checking to see if food was ok, no nothing.  So sad.
author: Q Q.

description:
The food is your typical diner fare but the view is better than most fine dining establishments. Located in an understated building with well-worn furniture, it's an affordablely unique place to eat. Too bad at this time of year they close just prior to the sunset.
The service is good too, friendly and engaging. Parking at the ever popular Land's End may be difficult, depending on the time of day and week.
author: Tina K.

description: I enjoy Louis and have been bringing my son here monthly since his 2nd month of life. I don't mind waiting to get a seat or sitting at the counter - what I REALLY dislike are some of the wait staff. sitting at the counter I've watched them stand around, appear unmotivated, complain about fellow staff, talk about getting drunk, count their tips in front of guests, and yet I have to ask to be served.  The lady that usually greets guests is super friendly and hard working however and you can't fault the food either.
author: Jon G.

description: Love his place. Food is great, staff is friendly and the view is unbeatable. Make sure to bring enough cash as they are cash only.
author: Allan R.

description: The worst service I ever got!!! I understand we came there late, 30 minutes before they closed but the server girl didn't even offer us ordering food or a second drink before giving us the bill... 0 tip first time ever
author: Kamil N.

description: Lovely lunch on a Friday. No crowds and seated right away. It was an overcast morning however the view of the Sutro baths was very nice. Food is average diner fare, freshly made. Cash only accepted however they have an ATM. Service was great, we would return as the view was great and conveniently located near trails.
author: Damaris F.

description: I've never had a bad meal at this place. I love going here when it's storming out. Great food, great service, great times always. Parking could be hard at times but it pays to get their early.
author: Nancy M.

description: Service is inattentive and rude. Food is ridiculously overpriced and mediocre to lousy. SKIP THIS PLACE. Views are nice but they're better if you get up, walk out, and sit on any bench for free instead of $$$ and just eat something you've packed. Pretty much nothing in terms of vegetarian or vegan options. Gross. Skip it.
author: A. C.

description:
Pros
Food is reasonable
Great view

Cons
For more than 4 people waiting time is 40min at least
waiting outside is very unpleasant in the chilli wind

This is my 3rd time in this joint so when they told us would take around 45 minutes to accommodate us we were not surprised. 

We were a group of 6 people waiting for at least 30min when some employees or former ones came in. Then the hostess asked for a couple of patrons to move for another table, as they were occupying a 6 table, which they gently agreed. I naively thought they're going to accommodate us, but no! The employees group sat down and we were told to wait for the next 6 table available - 10 more minutes at least
I understand having 'family' over is good sign, but respect first is a must, no matter what.
Our last and final visit for sure.
author: Leila R.

description:
2 stars  for the view- beautiful. 
The food not great - view spectacular
Service - lackluster - view extraordinary. 

I think the real reason this place is still in business is location location location. 

The food had no flavor, the fries frozen then heated. The burger I had was just so bland. 

The service was neither good or bad nor was it friendly or pleasant .  There was little to no energy from the staff. 
This is a tourist go to, plain and simple - it's all about the view
author: Janet C.

description:
My favorite SF breakfast restaurant.  The servers are always friendly and efficient.
Of course, the view is outstanding.  It always makes me a little sad because I use
to go to Sutro Baths for swimming and also Playland.  
The food is very good and this is the place I recommend to my friends
who want to tour San Francisco.
Lots of free parking close by.
author: Bob J.

description: I had Louis' bacon Benedict and my boyfriend had the French toast. We also split a Danish which was a wonderfully necessary indulgence! The bacon Benedict was beyond delicious. Some of the best bacon I've ever had and the breakfast potatoes were the perfect combination of crispy and soft. The French toast was deliciously seasoned - I only had a couple bites but would've eaten half of my boyfriend's meal if I would've had the stomach capacity. Even the coffee was terrific! And the amazing seaside view made it all 100x better. Gorgeous views and delicious food. What more do you need?!
author: Jacquie H.

description:
Arrived around 9:45 am on a Sunday and was quoted a 20 minutes wait for four. (Reality was more like 30 minutes.) Walking down to Sutro Baths was a nice way to kill some of the time. 

I couldn't resist one of the benedicts. There are three to choose from: classic (ham), Louis' (bacon and tomato) or Veggie. I got the veggie and our server happily swapped out the side of potatoes for sliced tomatoes. The eggs were perfectly poached over an ample amount of grilled onions, mushrooms, tomato...all on top of an english muffin and topped with a decadent hollandaise. Yum. 

Sure, you could be all fancy and go to the Cliff House...OR you can come here to get a similarly excellent view and delicious food at a more reasonable cost.
author: Emily J.

description:
Louis offers three things I love: Breakkies, sweeping views of the ocean, and a great story of how it came to be a special SF mom and pop. 

The lowdown: 

* Louis is pronounced Louie

* Louis' Restaurant opened on Sunday, February 14, 1937

* 6.26.66 Louis restaurant was spared by the fire that destroyed the adjacent Sutro 

*Grappling for power going on with the National Park over concessions. 

*Every seat in the restaurant offers a stunning view. 

* Restaurant has been owned and run by generations of family - making this a great old school mom and pop! 

* Cash only (pay cash as often as you can when going to mom and pops anyway to avoid making them pay ridiculous credit card blackmail acceptance fees - err, processing fees). 

*Restaurant is intimate so keep your big group action to a minimum of 4-6 especially at peak times

*Abundant parking on the street as well as at the lot across the street. 

Read more factoids and about the great history: http://www.louissf.com/

I really like Louis. I had a custom white egg scramble and one of each pancake, french toast, and waffle. If you are craving starchy carbs, get the waffles! The coffee was yummy! I was very full and really happy. 

Service was friendly and unrushed. 

Prices are fair. 

I am happy to come here again. . . on a weekday to beat the crowds!
author: Jennifer C P.

description: We went to Land's End to see the sunset but it was a little early; that was why we came in Louis' to have something to eat and wait for the sunset. Definitely a-million-buck view at any window seat. It was right across from the ocean up on the hill. The food was okay I guess? We had a small cup of minestrone and french fries. French fries were made to order; they came to the table warm and crispy. Although the soup was a little bit salty, it was ok. If you want to enjoy the sunset view and don't want to throw away $80 at Cliffhouse, Louis' would be a very good alternative. Interesting old-fashioned diner with a long history.
author: Ciel C.

description:
Awesome view from any of the booths or tables, but this is a small restaurant so it gets full quickly. They encourage people to share the large tables which is cool. 

The chili is nice on a chilly day. Lovely marmalade set out of the tables!! Prices are a bit crazy considering it's only average diner fair, but you're paying their rent- ocean front property. 

The servers are pleasant & I appreciate that the servers didn't try to rush me out as there were people waiting for a table.
author: Sophia O.

description: The breakfast was "meh" pretty pricey because you're paying for the great views!! And it's "cash only"!!! I can now marked off my list of must do's!!
author: Tracey D.

description:
I ate here on Sunday, January 17.  It was a foggy morning, so the view wasn't much, but that's what life in SF is like ... fog is frequent.   I was a solo diner, and was immediately seated at the counter.  It was about 9:30 or 10am, but I was able to order their fish and chips for breakfast.  

I had their clam chowder first; would have preferred New England style, but the Manhattan style was adequate, if a bit sparse on the clams.  Sourdough bread was tasty, if cold.  Fish and chips were perfectly serviceable; really not crazy about frozen crinkle fries, but at least they were crisp.

Service was friendly and attentive, and food delivery was super fast.  I usually have breakfast at the Cliff House, but didn't due to a communication mix-up, so I was very happy to have Louis' as a seaside option.
author: Bret B.

description: I love this place - very cozy.  The food is basic coffee shop food but the quality is good.  I've gotten the fried shrimp and the tuna melt and both were delicious.  Plus with the sandwiches you can substitute salad for fries which is nice.  And the best part is you get the same spectacular view as the cliff house at 1/3rd the price.
author: G. R.

description:
Louis' is a favorite stop every time I'm in town.  It's got the most amazing view of the Sutro Baths and the gorgeous Pacific Ocean, it's a historic landmark, and it's family owned.  The place is small, tables are close together with a few counter spaces.  The food is classic diner food (breakfasts, omelets, deli sandwiches, etc) but I've only ever eaten breakfast stuff.  Eggs, omelets, pancakes are good, solid choices.  Food comes out simply and without decoration or garnishing.   

Service is good; I don't think it's anything amazing.  If you need special attention or are looking for something fancy or ritzy you're in the wrong place!  The people who work here are kind and local-- if you are nice to them and gracious, they will be good to you.  If you are demanding you probably won't get that coffee refill quite as quickly as you might like.

It's definitely casual.  Cash only.  No waiting area/lobby, and oftentimes outside is REALLY windy, so be prepared.  Avoid weekends, whenever possible, as this place gets packed.  

Recently, Louis' has taken steps to have higher quality food.  Their website, www.louissf.com says all their meat is antibiotic-free and hormone free.  Their eggs are organic.  Their coffee is certified organic.  Their vegetables are organic whenever possible and are local.  All their bread and desserts are local.  Additionally, they have made efforts to improve recycling (even their leftover cooking oils!) and incorporate recycled material into their renovations.  

I'm headed there tomorrow for breakfast, and I can't wait to see (and taste) the changes.  My local relatives eat there often, so we're friendly with the staff. 

A few things they could improve on:  first, I am not a big fan of the breakfast potatoes.  I find them kind of boring.  Also, I wish the coffee cups were larger because I don't like getting all these refills and constantly adjusting the cream/sugar.
author: Heather E.

description:
really disappointed about the restaurant. big change compared some years ago. 
not good attention, very hot without fans, no cards allowed, only cash
author: Fernando F.

description: It's a great location, but not worth your visit if you are looking for some great food!!! We were told the wait was 25-30 mins, but end up waiting for almost an hour, so beware of what they told you about the wait time.  It's a very small place and turnover time is slow.  The food is absolutely not worth the wait either.  We ordered burgers.  They were mediocre the most. Go somewhere else if you are looking for a good place to eat!
author: Dede L.

description:
I stopped by here after a run to grab breakfast. When I'm running I only carry a credit card and a house key. I sat down, put both on the table and ordered. When bringing my eggs out, the waitress mentioned that they only take cash, and I said that I only had credit but could return and pay. She said it would probably be fine to leave my name so I went ahead and ate. When I was ready to leave she asked for my ID and I let her know I didn't have one with me. She called the owner then returned saying that he "didn't believe my story, and that I should have an ID". I asked her if she let him know that she was looking at me and that the story checks out. She said no, and that the owner wanted her to call the police. I was bewildered that this is how the owner wanted to handle such an easily resolvable situation over a $12 egg plate. I offered to send cash with venmo or square to any staffers who had the app but they all claimed to not have it. Luckily another customer walked in who did, so I paid him in exchange for cash. 

It's really a shame. The food was mediocre but the view was nice and would have made a good place to end runs in the future. I had run by the restaurant countless times but this was the first I had stopped. The owner could have been civil and gained a return patron, but instead decided to threaten to call the police and escalate the situation. Sometimes it pays off to take people at their word and trust that they're decent people.

Next time I'll just run past.
author: Scott H.

description:
The food here is no good. Worse than Denny's. I won't be back.

The view is awesome but not worth my time. I don't know how to cook and my meals come out tasting twice as good. I don't know if the quality of food went down or the kitchen staff changed but the food is not as good as I remember. 

$20. Coffee and Eggs Benedict. Cash only but there is an ATM.
author: Justin S.

description:
Small place yet so delicious. 
The best eggs Benedict I ve ever had!!! As a matter fact I believe I be only had two other items on the menu I always go for the eggs Benedict.
French toast also quite delicious.
Not to mention the view!!!!
Expect a wait almost every time but is definitely worth the wait.
author: Imelda G.

description:
A damn nice breakfast place with great service and view. If you are looking for a High end place than this might not be the place... But if you are looking for a nice family style treatment than this is it. 

I have taken everyone who has visited me in the city who I really love here for breakfast
author: Shruti P.

description:
Awesome greasy spoon - locals favorite since it opened. If you go, you have to get a malt. The food is general American food - burgers, fries, salads, fish and chips, etc. Just a delicious old-style diner type of restaurant. The staff is nice, they keep your glass full, and I've never had them get an order wrong.
I've been coming here since I was a little girl - ask for a window booth and enjoy an old San Francisco classic.
author: Evan Q.

description: Absolutely stunning view of the ocean and the cliffs I would not recommend the fish and chips however they tasted like what you would expect from a super market box of fish sticks I'm sure the other menu items are good but the cost of what we paid for versus what we got was unsatisfactory I would go again but would not order the same thing
author: Michael E.

description:
The chili cheese open-face burger was good. The service was fine.

It was an excellent beginning of my day-trip to the area to check out the Sutro Baths and The Legion of Honor, but I don't think I'd ever go out of my way to just come here. Cash only is also a turn off.
author: Ryan H.

description:
Perfec example of a place that gets by on location only. High priced bad food. I went for breakfast and wanted an omelette. It would have cost $20 dollars to get everything I wanted in it, as they charge extra for anything other than cheese.          I would have paid maybe $10 at the most anywhere else, so I settled for just a cheese omelette. The food was mediocre at best. The service was ok. 
I was stayed at an Airb&b within walking distance of this place. I would have loved to have breakfast here every morning but I couldn't justify the expense for not good food. So sad
author: Silvia M.

description: We arrived here by accident after looking for a casual bite to eat near Golden Gate Park. Our Uber driver recommended the Cliff House, however, a small cafe a few steps up the road caught our eye. If you're looking for breathtaking views and traditional "diner" food, this place is for you! They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner (in addition to beer & wine). A booth by the window is worth the wait. If you're fortunate enough to visit Lands End, this is a great place to eat.
author: Christine M.

description: Great food. Great view. Great everything. You'll have to wait, but it's worth it for a small party. Hot chocolate is SO good, caesar salad is great, but breakfast food and other super hearty egg/meat/sauce/potato dishes seem to be the real winners here.
author: Lori J.

description:
Poor service, this jerk server whom identified himself as "Dominic" has the gall to ask my wife for paperwork regarding my wife's properly tagged and identified service animal, stating that "He knows the law" 

This is the most unprofessional service one can expect when traveling with a service animal. To all the folks out there, save yourselves the hassle, this "gentleman" needs a training course on professionalism and courtesy. 

Going forward I recommend avoiding this place like the plague unless you want cafeteria food served by an unprofessional staff. 

Take a walk a little bit further down the road and spend the extra couple of bucks at The Cliff House and avoid this place all together.
author: Luis C.

description: This little place used to be the best kept secret known to locals, the word is out and the lines can be long on weekends but it's TOTALLY worth it! Great omelettes, pancakes, etc. Very affordable, and the ocean views are breathtaking. Go there!
author: e w.

description: I actually like coming here, nothing fancy but good American comfort food. Cash only!
author: Via Fume C.

description:
Fun little small restaurant. I think the main word is, "Small."  The food is good but due to its size this restaurant is often crowded and waits can be long. The best times to go, if you don't want to wait, is off hours.

All this being said, I do recommend this restaurant. Great location and good food.
author: Scott S.

description: I can't believe we almost avoided this place because several yelp reviewers complained about how unfriendly the server was. Our experience was the exact opposite.
