We had the nicest waitress! She was welcoming and friendly, and she gladly accommodated special requests re. food allergies and preferences. As for the reviewers who complained about the food, it's a diner.  It's diner food. We thought our food was tasty and exactly what we wanted (grilled cheese, tuna melt, fries, bottomless hot coffee) after our 4 hour hike. Would give 5 stars if they accepted credit cards.
author: Jen S.

description: Great food and an even better view. We were amazed to see whales surfacing just outside the surf line.
author: Mike W.

description:
The tables were sticky.  The chairs at our booth were torn.

We ordered an egg sandwich and a tuna sandwich plus coffee for over $25.  The bread was dry.  The fries were store bought frozen fries.

After the meal, we had to pay cash because credit cards are not accepted.

A horrible experience!  Do not patronize this restaurant.
author: Djl D.

description: Great view with good basic menu with generous portions.  We had Eggs Benedict and a spinach salad.  Excellent service.  You pay a little more for the great location.
author: SCOTT A.

description:
I live in SF and took a visiting friend to this restaurant. It is a typical tourist trap.
The view is good but the accommodations and food truly embarrassed me . Terrible clam chowder. There was sand type particles in our Greek salad. We asked them to examine it. They said no and in essence told us to take it or leave it.
The toilet door opens to the restaurant and you could see the inside every time someone goes in n out..,.. Prices far exceed the quality ... I will never return to this place
author: Kambiz Y.

description: The location and view is awesome and the waitress was nice but my omelet was very plain and tasteless. Basically a Denny's with a nice view.
author: Chris S.

description:
I was very disappointed in the meal and service. My husband and I came in on a Monday morning after July 4th. The hostess was nice enough, but the server that gave us the menu and the server that took our order made It clear they did not want to be there. No smiles, no greeting, not much effort at all. The only chatting, laughter and smiles I witnessed the entire time we were there were from the cook, the other two workers and a friend sitting at the counter. 

Now onto the food. I ordered the classic Benedict and my husband the cheeseburger. The Benedict sauce was obviously from a powder mix and the potatoes were frozen and cooked in a deep fryer. It was overdone, dry and tasteless. The plate had no garnishment and looked unappealing. The cheeseburger was small and the cheese looked like processed cheese. The only provided ketchup and mustard in its containers. We had to ask for mayonnaise and they were chintzy about the portion. The serving of fries were only a nominal handful. We ordered a coffee (no refill or top-off offered) and a coke. Husband had to ask for a refill twice, and still server never offered me coffee. The total bill was nearly $40. OH! They only accept cash!! There is an ATM by the door and it charges you over a $2 service fee. 

The only thing they have going for themselves is the view and the location.  I can't give them stars for that. They didn't earn it. It's unfortunate the restaurant uses this to their advantage and forgoes providing a good meal. I am very disappointed and will not be back ever. 

Oh, one more thing. The place was closed for a bit for its renovation. The only thing I noticed that was changed was the bathroom. Other than that everything looked the same, maybe new equipment in kitchen or a new dishwasher, but even than, the place didn't look immaculate. Crumbs, signs of liquid drips on stainless steel and rack next to coffee maker was rusted and dirty. Gross! Maybe instead of yucking it up with their friends, they should clean. 

Okay, that's it for me....I'm so done, so done with this restaurant. It's a shame since its been around for over 50 years.
author: Kalo M.

description:
Myself and a friend came here for lunch yesterday. It was a Monday and not too busy. We sat at the counter to get faster service as we were very hungry. As we looked over the menu, we overheard the chit chat of the three 20 something wait staff. We were told "she will be with you in a minute" as we sat there, menus closed, to order. 

5 minutes later, the waitress who apparently was working the counter, started going to another table to take an order. That table had just sat down. Her co-worker had to remind her to look at us and take our order. 

She couldn't have been more aloof, unfriendly or caring. Once the order was placed, she turned her back and counted her tips. More chit chat with co-workers, never once checking in on us. I had to ask another staffer for a refill, and the check.

I thought I would support a local restaurant, but regret coming in. Owners, you should really re-consider your staffing choices.
author: Christopher E.

description: Wonderful Cliff Side , ocean view restaurant.  Wonderful, tastey food, nicely prepared, great service, excellent value.  The views outside of the restaurant are SPECTACULAR - history of old, former bath houses, and other fun things to see!  Highly recommend the Hamburger and Cheeseburger!!!!!!!!!  Friendly service.  Would love to visit again next year.
author: Dr Yolanda C Leon L.

description:
Great view. Have been coming for years. Food is average but will keep coming back. 

What was great today was that after coming here for over 35 years, we saw three whales going by.
author: Mike G.

description:
We ate here in mid-December, and I'm glad I had cash on me, because I didn't know this place was cash only when we decided to visit. There's an ATM inside, but I don't like running up fees.

The service was slow, we never got refills on our waters, and I was not impressed with our 20-something server; she was not particularly friendly.

The food was about the same as what we get at one of our local diners, but at a higher price. None of us were full when we left, which is unusual at breakfast.
author: Amy H.

description: This place works especially if you are hungry after walking around and thru lands end.  Just had the ham and eggs.  Nice view from the window.
author: Leslie R.

description: Great views! Cash only, fast service. The portions are big and decent to taste. My veggie Omelette was good. Parking right across and street. Visiting lands end? Give it a shot.
author: Doc R.

description:
Louis' food is pathetic. It's a poor reflection on San Francisco's outstanding food reputation. It's location is owned by the GGNRA and sadly its lease was recently renewed. I made the mistake of going to this dive years ago and will never step foot in this joint again. You can get the same Sysco distributed stuff at Denny's for much less.

If you're visiting San Francisco, go to Ocean Beach and enjoy a leisurely walk on the beach. Walk the trails down the site of the Sutro Baths and visit the newly constructed  Golden Gate National Recreation Area visitors center. Walk the Lands End trail from Fort Miley to Sea Cliff.

Louis' is just a lame old restaurant hanging on to the cliff by a thread. The food here is less than appetizing and way overpriced for the quality provided.
author: Perry V.

description:
I visited here several times.
When i visit San Francisco, Stay near here.

My first time was dec 1999.
And it was first time meal of San Francisco.
Therefore, Louis' is my memorial place. ;-)

In june 2013.
I visited here again.
I had a breakfast.
It is good, But this portion is too much for me.
That day is very foggy.
If fine day, maybe window side is very nice ocean view.
And I think, stay here for it long time.

http://www.heartbeat.info/usa/1999-2000usa/archives/entry/entry_19991207010000.html

サンフランシスコに滞在する時は、ここの近くにある宿を使っていることもあり、サンフランシスコでの初めての食事はここでした。
天気が良いとここからの眺めは最高ですね。

結構、歴史のあるお店のようで、これからも長く続けて欲しいですね。
author: Yasuhiro T.

description:
We wanted to drink a cup of coffee and eat an ice cream and pie. We ordered the coffee and when the waitress came back to take the order, she told us that they have a policy that if they have new guests they may ask us to move to the bar. We explained that we just want to drink coffee for 15 minutes and she said that's the policy. We asked to leave and she asked us to pay for the coffee which we have not drinked.
They also don't accept credit cards. Only cash.
The attitude is arrogant and this is not the way to handle a family business.
author: Eran P.

description:
So excited that they are reopening soon.... my cutting high school days were spent here.  Took now DH here on our second date.  

From Thomas Hontalas
Hey Sunsetters,
On behalf of my family, I would like to officially announce the reopening date of our restaurant, Louis' - Wednesday, August 3, 2011. After 8 long months of delays, frustration and a lot of money spent, we are almost good to go!!! We will be open daily from 6:30AM - 9:00PM. Please come by to visit and have a great meal. We look forward to seeing and serving you real soon!!! Check us out on our new website - Louisf.com.
author: Erika G.

description:
They've just re-opened after a year and a half of remodeling, and we came here for the first time for a Sunday dinner (Aug 14).   Even tho the place was pretty full, we were seated within 5 min. and orders taken right away by pleasant friendly servers.

I had the Louie Salad & sparkling wine and my friend had the chili burger, fries,  and a shake.  (see pics)  The food was OK, but the view of the ocean and the Sutro Ruins was breath-taking.   And I agree with other reviewers that the food is uninspired and probably from cans and frozen products.

And they are CASH ONLY.  I'd probably be back if they took credit cards, but "cash only" is a deal breaker.  I'd rather walk the 300 steps down the hill over to the Cliffhouse.
author: David S.

description: I really want to love this place - I've been here about a dozen times in the last few years but I won't come again. The service is atrocious- I mean - you'd need to be a zen master not to be annoyed. I don't mind the basic diner food, and the view is truly stunning, but if you don't feel like arguing with an eye rolling teenager about why she seated a party of two that arrived after you at the only table in the restaurant big enough for your party of six, then maybe grab a shake to go and sit on the beach.
author: Kate O.

description: Never get the "regular" orange juice. The cup is small as an espresso shot cup. Honestly, pay the extra dollar to get the full size cup of orange juice. But the reason it has four stars is because the food here delicious.
author: Hello P.

description: Shrimp salad ($16) had sweet shrimp and very crisp iceberg lettuce.  The dressing tasted home made.  The french bread was fresh and good. The coffee is great.  The view is really good and you can see the Sutro Bath ruins and the ocean.  It is a no frill place, more like a diner.
author: R P.

description: We came here for the view. There could be a wait if you go during meal time. Free street parking, free lot across the street, or free lands end lot. Your paying for eating with a view. The food is average and nothing bad about it. Sampled fish & chips, BLT, omelette. All tasted as good as you can make at home. More expensive option is to eat in Cliff House down the hill. Cheaper option is to bring your own sandwich or takeout and eat in Lands End viewing area benches / concrete studs. This is a cash only restaurant with ATM by the door if needed.
author: Clifford W.

description: Great food, great service!  My husband and I ate breakfast here before our hike through Lands End to Bakers Beach.  Nice and simple, no wait, and fast easy service.  Most of the staff here were some nice college kids.  Loved the view of Ocean Beach and Sutro Heights.  Will definitely have to come back again.
author: Rosie M.

description:
Tourist trap. You know it when you see the menu

We were hungry., We should have had breakfast before we went to Muir Woods

Instead we went here after our hike (Came for Sutro Baths). Big mistake. Everything is overpriced. We split a cheeseburger and fries for $9.95 a relative bargain. It came out looking like something I could get at Wendy's for $1.49. Skimpy on the condiments. Crinkle fries from a bag. 

Want a view? Look around, you don't need to eat here. My advice. Eat somewhere else first and skip this forgettable spot

CASH ONLY
author: Rachael C.

description: I had Louie's Benedict this Sunday and it was quite good. The service was excellent and we fortuitously got the table with the best view. One person in our group of four people was a wheelchair user and she appreciated the accessibility.
author: Sophie L.

description:
Good diner by the sutro baths. The food came fast and was decent. We had the eggs Benedict...nothing special about it just average. The waiters were a little slow...we asked for refills about 4 times before we actually had our drinks refilled. The staff just seemed lost and confused.

Would I be back? Sure why not if I'm in the area and don't feel like spending a fortune...the food may be average but the view is spectacular!
author: Jessica A.

description:
Rude service by the hostess.    On September 2, at approximately 3:30 PM, I met 3 friends over at Louis'.  Upon my arrival, they had already been there WAITING to have their order taken and for their food to arrive for 30+ minutes prior.  15 minutes after my arrival & my friends had been served their food, we were REPRIMANDED publicly and forced by the hostess to be re-seated at a COUNTER-SPACE.  

Let me explain:  My 3 friends had been sitting at one of the 2 tables put together near the window.  When I arrived, we had politely asked the family of 3 seated at the table  next to us if one of us could sit at their table and they nicely agreed.  Shortly thereafter, the hostess came up to us to tell us to MOVE and to give the family PRIVACY.  RUDE, RUDE, RUDE!   OK, so it was busy, but this young lady needs some customer service skills.  She could have POLITELY explained to us to shift over to our own table, instead of RUDELY telling us to move to a counter space.  She could have CALMLY explained that because we were spread across 2 tables, that we were inconveniencing staff and the patrons next to us.  Yet, she REPRIMANDED customers without any decorum!!!!  SO RUDE that I refused to order anything!  

As you can see from my review history, I tend to be a reviewer who does not give 1 star reviews lightly.  I was raised, unlike the hostess, to have manners and be polite.  Yet, I must say that I cannot and WILL NOT recommend this restaurant to tourists, friends or anyone in my yelp, facebook and social media circle.  There are SO MANY more choices that are friendlier even with a crowd.  

AVOID!
author: Hiromi N.

description:
An ok spot to stop for coffee and a view. 

- the chili was watery
- Egg sandwich was meh. It tasted more like a hamburger :/ (clearly they just cooked a burger where my eggs were cooked)

Pro: the grilled cheese & fries were really good.
+Friendly service and when the waitress noticed that we didn't like the chili she took it off our bill.
author: Sabrina J.

description:
This place must have been great in the older days with the older employees.

I don't usually rely on Yelp, but this time most reviews were accurate based on my experience.

Wasn't happy with our server. He made us feel he wasn't happy to be serving us. I don't know if it's restaurant policy not to put ice in your water, unless you ask and we had to ask for straws. No water or coffee refill offers, had to ask everytime. Hot sauce and steak sauce bottles almost empty.
Fried shrimp closed to burnt; fries soggy.  I liked my steak though. My husband wasn't so lucky with his choice. Paid good amount of money for generally fastfood quality meal (actually had better fastfood meal).

Of course the view was great, that's why my husband and I came in the first place.
Not going back and not gonna recommend.

Only saving grace was the nice hostess.
Should have gone to Cliffhouse like we usually do.
author: Pam S.

description:
I wouldn't call this place a tourist trap, but they know who they are catering to. It's obvious that Louis' has gotten away with being so-so because its only other competition is an upscale restaurant. For all of those that want a scaled down and simple meal, they are there to deliver.

The food here is ok. Nothing was great, but it wasn't bad, either. It was better than Denny's but in no way better than the Cliff House's breakfast (always go with the Cliff House over Louis' if you can). 

The service was slow and since the place is tiny, there is always a wait. It's cash only and they conveniently have an ATM inside. 

For two people to have breakfast it was about $40, which was steep in my opinion. We each ordered normal breakfast fare, so I don't know how it got to be that much. 

Walking around outside is free. If you want ambiance and a dining experience, skip this place. 

THE VIEW CAN GO F*** ITSELF IF THE FOOD AND SERVICE IS LAME. DO PEOPLE REALLY COME HERE SOLELY ON THE VIEW?
author: Bianca U.

description: Louis' has simple breakfast food with a beautiful view of Ocean Beach when it's not super foggy. The food is a little overpriced for the quantity. I have been here a few times with friends and family. After breakfast, we often go for a walk at Lands End and what used to be the Sutro Baths.
author: Christina M.

description:
Solid diner with reasonable prices and a beautiful view.

The only setback is that they only take cash. I ended my run here one day and only had my credit card, and their ATM was broken. I suggested I Venmo someone there, but they made me go to Cliff House and use the ATM there, while they took my Clipper Card as collateral. Cliff House's ATM didn't work with my credit card, and the gift shop didn't give cash back, so I came back empty-handed and finally got a waiter to download Venmo and paid him that way. Pretty stressful / uncaring for a $10 burger.
author: Cynthia W.

description:
Good job.

This one: http://www.ispot.tv/ad/7NL1/chantix-louis

And this one: Delicious egg white omelette with generous chunks of chicken apple sausage. Paired perfectly with wheat toast and roasted potatoes.

We also split an order of oatmeal. Made with a water base and served with brown sugar and cinnamon. Filling and satisfying.

Altogether it was a reasonable less than $20/person.

Taking things from three to four stars was the amazing view of the Pacific Ocean and attentive and friendly service. Over 75 years in business earns them kudos too.

First Louis gets five stars for the steps he took to be around 75+ years too.
author: Jason B.

description: Can't beat the location, and I was pretty happy with the food. The ceasar salad was good and the burger. The atmosphere was only 2 stars. The bathroom had poo on the floor, dirty plates stacked up on the counter and the staff was very noisy with the silverware and their own conversations. A pleasant conversation would be interrupted by utensils being thrown in a bin. I was not busy, so the uncleanliness was inexcusable. It is a small place, so noise is expected. Not sure if we'll return, unfortunately.
author: Bex G.

description: The view is Fantastic! The food is good! It is one of the smallest restaurants I've ever been in. Great family vibe. You will probably need to wait to get a table its worth it though. Great comfort food. I had the Sutro Sandwich. It was really good I especially liked the Sourdough roll. The portions are huge! I should have split my meal. The wait staff seems to have a workman like attitude towards there service and were not friendly at all. I would come back for the food and view which really are consistent and good. They only take Cash.
author: Jeff C.

description: I really like this place primarily for the view and its mom and pop type vibe and history. Good for primarily breakfast, nothing fancy and decent prices (for the breakfast dishes) especially for a really touristy area of San Francisco where prices are generally inflated. Downside is they only take cash.
author: p f.

description: Amazing views with so-so food. This is one of those daily morning routine spots. Fair service and easy casual menu. I loved my side of chicken apple sausage. That plus one piece of French toast came out to $11ish in which I still felt kind of hungry after. Not sure if I would rush to come back since food and service was just average. I definitely could've used at least one coffee refill.
author: Amanda N.

description: How do you mess up a salad? This was the worse so called spinach salad I have ever had. Bland and soggy. Nothing delightful about the taste. Waiter was nice. If the plate is full, obviously something was right about the meal. I just hate wasting money. This was a waste.
author: Sharon D.

description:
My friends and I decided to check out Lands End during our trip up to SF since we have done most of the other touristy things before.

After trekking around for a bit, we stumbled upon Louis' and decided it would be a good place to grab a late lunch.

We were seated at one of the long tables and had a great view of the ocean.

This place is a known tourist trap/diner so I decided to keep it simple and ordered a french burger. For what it was, it was decent, the only complaint I would have is that the bun was a bit too large and it was pretty bland. The fries and chocolate shake that I tried of my friends was good.

The service was also attentive and the food came out at a reasonable speed. The prices were reasonable too so its not a bad alternative, especially since the Cliff House restaurants are always booked and don't stay open too late for lunch.

Overall, nothing amazing but a decent place to eat if you want to grab something right around the area.
author: Ryan R.

description:
We waited about 25-30minutes for a table of 5 which seems about the right amount of time we weren't very bothered by that very much. There isn't alot of waiting area inside so it's best to wait in the car or outside the restaurant. 

We went inside and the view was very nice. The waitress quickly took our order and the food came out pretty fast. I ordered a egg white omelette it wasn't anything special. 

This is when everything went downhill. Our waitress didn't come back once after we got our food to ask us how everything was she didn't even come back to fill our waters. We then waited around 10minutes still no waitress so I asked my boyfriend to go find her to find out she was on a shift change. Mind you she didn't even let us know and didn't come back with our checks she made another waitress do this all for her. Not even a thank you from her at the end, and she was probably doing her side work in the back to leave. 

Worst service we got in San Francisco, I am also a server and was visiting from hawaii. A local recommend nothing special though wont be coming here again.
author: Elizbeth B.

description: I have always loved this place.  It's just casual food!  It's not hipster brunch, it's a regular, inexpensive place, with an amazing view.  I was so happy when they remodeled a few years ago and made it look so much like it used to look!  I think the food is simple and delicious.  Fluffy eggs, fresh greens, tasty coffee, unassuming french toast the way diners make it, not all fancy bread and fancy sauces.  And the folks who work here are really attentive and sweet, even when it gets busy on weekends.  Favorite place to take visitors, but also a perfect spot to meet old friends.
author: Samantha G.

description:
Oh the trouble with the yelp rating system. No half stars and only an over all rating.  I know, it has to be this way. Thank goodness for the comments.

So really, it's a 3.5, but it got 3 because it IS a restaurant and restaurants are supposed to be about FOOD, and the food wasn't anything special. 

So.

Food = 3 stars. Like yelp says A-Ok. Very much diner food. My hollandaise sauce I think came from a packet.  Not bad per say, but flavor? Not so much.  My eggs were actually poached really well.  I was impressed with that.  The potatoes, were potatoes. I think they may have been previously frozen, but were nice and crispy.  The bacon was actually pretty tasty too. 

View = 6 stars. Maybe 7. I mean, on a sunny day it really doesn't get much better than this.  There are some none window seats, but really not that many...

Service = 4 stars. Everyone seemed friendly.  The food came relatively quickly.

Wait = 3 stars. We waited. 15 minutes. But it was a saturday at 10:30 on a beautiful day. What are you going to do?  

Coffee = 1 star. Denny's anyone?  (I actually secretly love bad coffee, so I didn't mind at all, but at $2.50 I still have to give it one star)/

Price = 2 stars.  Normal San Francisco more than I really want to pay, but for Diner Quality? I mean I COULD go to Denny's and pay maybe half as much.....

In conclusion: worth it for the view. Absolutely. But don't go expecting to be impressed in any sort of culinary way.
author: Sarah C.

description:
BRING CASH

COME EARLY . . . or don't so that we can still get our table.

By itself, I would probably give Louis' 3 stars, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. The interior looks and feels like a diner -- I personally love diners, so this is a plus. The food tastes like diner food (not horrible Denny's, more real than that!). I'm talking about the kind of diner that families used to stop at when they would take road trips all across the nation, and it gives that kind of nostalgic feel, too.

I've never had a dish that made me go woah. Everything's just decent and satiating. We've tried most of the egg dishes, hamburgers, fish and chips, pancakes.

Service is usually great 90% of the time . . . like you would expect from a traditional diner. Am I getting the gist across here?

I do love their coffee. Keep the refills pouring into those small mugs! Maybe it's the mug? I don't know. I like it better than bluebottle and all the other fancy shmancy coffees in SF. Yes, it's not as strong as a lot of their blends, but it's juuuust right every time we go whether you like it black, with milk, or whatever.

And that 4th star? The view, of course. Unless it's a blue-sky day, it's always different when we look out and I love that unpredictability. Sometimes you'll see the fog slowly disappear and reveal a gorgeous view. Other times you'll see giant birds up above riding the wind. Sometimes you'll just see people doing funny and unexpected things out at the Sutro Baths.

We love getting the booth and bringing visiting family and friends to this joint. We've always arrived before any lines early in the morning ~7/8. Pretty easy to find parking.

Best part: everyone leaves happy every time.
author: Michelle D.

description: Kathy our waitress is like a cool drink of water after a very long hike in the desert.  She makes you painfully aware of what good service should be like and how I have NOT been getting it from other restaurants.  Her calm smile and demeanor makes one feel very welcomed to be dining at HER restaurant.  Okay, it's not hers but she takes much pride there in what she does.  Kudos to Kathy.   Great views and good food.  Can't wait to go back!
author: Nancy L.

description: Food was mediocre. Service was horrible. I was upset that all the waitresses and waiters were very rude and unhelpful. They were unaware of their surroundings and speaking ill of customers. They ruined my experience. Do not plan on ever going back.
author: Sonia V.

description: I have been coming to this place since I was little and now I bring family and friends, but today was by far the worst experience ever! I brought my two daughters while baiting from New York and invited my brother from another country with his family. The cashier/ hostess - probably the youngest gal there- was the rudest ever. First, she said I could not be seated until all of my party was there, this is totally understood. 40 min later I asked to be seated because my daughters were hungry and I wanted to order, she again asked if more people were coming and didn't seat me. Then I sat at the bar, asked for a menu and was going to at least get hot chocolates while we waited - she AGAIN came over and said once we ordered we couldn't move and she DIDN'T EVEN ASK what I wanted or how she could serve us!!! Even the gentlemen that was sitting having a coffee was moved to a table once it was open and asked for me to get the table with my two toddlers instead...Basic customer service - FAILED on so many levels!!! TERRIBLE!!!!! 15 years OF VISITING FROM WHEREVER I have been in my military career and recommending this place but I won't be back!!!
author: B G.

description: Nice and reasonably priced alternative to the Cliff House, if you are in that part of town. Diner-type food (I had fish and chips), and offers very nice views of the ocean, Sutro baths, etc. Reasonable prices and friendly service. Can get very crowded during peak hours, especially during tourist season.
author: Jethro B.

description:
Why oh why are you still in business when you offer such unappealing food either out of a can or frozen? 
Reduce your prices or figure out you're in SF where good, tasty food is a no-brainier!! 
The view is awesome and service is decent.   
Do not order Eggs Benedict or the bland potatoes that come with :-(
author: Barbara C.

description:
Worst quality food and service of any diner I've ever been to. Ever.

I don't expect stellar service at a diner but the servers kept us waiting over 15 minutes before they took our order.. and they weren't even busy or doing anything else! Just standing around chatting. I motioned for them to indicate we were ready to order, but the staff just looked at us, smiled, then continued chatting with each other. I had to ask at least 3 times before they gave me a straw. I had to request extra condiments that I wanted several times before they brought it to the table. Basically, you have to remind them again and again that you want something, wait a good 10 minutes, remind them AGAIN.. and then you'll get it. 

As for the food, well, it's crap. Worst spinach salad of my life. Stale leaves, flavorless vinaigrette, old pieces of bacon. My sister had the steak and eggs and was miserable. Driest, nastiest piece of steak ever. Seriously. I'm complaining because I'm telling you the truth. 

Customers are basically just paying for the view. 

I may as well have dined at the Cliffhouse. I thought I was saving money by dining at Louis' but I really just threw money away and wasted my time.
author: Jenny T.

description: If we were able to do zero out of 5 stars we would. First off the establishment is cash only which makes no sense considering its 2016. There's an ATM but it's a two dollar charge which is unfortunate considering the food is overpriced and mediocre. The service was horrible as we were seated and received lackluster service from a waitress who was rude and didn't even give her name. We only stopped in for a snack and the fries we ordered were bland and overpriced and looked like something you could find for a better price at the supermarket. Another two of our party came in just to sit and not order and while the hostess told them that ordering something would be fine, the waitress with no name rudely told them they would be "holding the kitchen up" and that all she could get them was water. While we waited for water refills and the check, our red headed waitress catered to everyone around us and ignored the fact that all we wanted to do was leave. All in all, the food is mediocre, the service is bad, and the only thing could salvage the visit was the view. Save yourself the trouble and hit up something closer to ocean beach that actually tastes good and is decently priced.
author: Ihsan M.

description: Good breakfast place on the outskirts of the city with an absolutely awesome view. Only bad thing is it's near impossible to find parking close by (likely due to the restaurant, Cliff House, Sutro Baths and the view itself). You'll either need to go up or down the hill, and walk, walk, walk. It's worth it though. Nice, cozy little place right on the hill looking out into the ocean. Staff is very friendly and attentive despite how busy it gets. Came here twice on Sundays and had to wait at least 20 minutes both times. I'd recommend it if you're in that area of the city, but certainly no need to go out of your way unless you're heading for the view.
author: Anthony D.

description: Great view, great food, great service, and great places to hike around afterwards including Sutro Baths, Sutro Park, Land's End, and a hiking trail to Golden Gate bridge if you like.
author: Greg T.

description:
Beautiful morning to go Point Lobos, but breakfast was a must. I have never been to Louis' before and was expecting it to be pricey because of the location. Surprisingly it is just a normal diner smelling of coffee and maple syrup. My man and I walk up and no line and a table with an awesome view of Sutro Baths. It wasn't noisy or crowded like I thought it would be, so right away I was happy. 

He got Benedict and it came with two way to big slices of ham that were not smoked. He thought they must of ran out of the canadian bacon and used the same ham that they use for the sandwiches. Hollandaise did not taste homemade at all, probably was Knorrs,(just add water), as well as once frozen potatoes on the side. Plate did not look that pretty or at all appetizing. 

My Burger, (I wanted huevos rancheros but no such luck), asked for medium and it came well done on the first few bites then medium well as I continued to eat, strange...and didn't come with onions? Just pickles, tomato, and crunchy lettuce.
Side salad with more beans than lettuce, wishing for homemade thousand island cus' it's the best, but nope nothing really fresh or homemade here.

I understand though, lowering your cost because regardless of what you do people still will eat there.

Service was excellent, very friendly and quick with coffee refills.

If I wouldn't have had a such an amazing view and a relaxing cozy atmosphere this would've got a 1 to 2 stars. So ya, I might go back with people to sit next to the window and have coffee, maybe try a sandwich next time.
author: Skye J.

description:
Perfect view!
May be even better than in Cliff House, as you can see more and you can see it as well)
Great place to have a meal while you exploring the best places of SF :)
author: Artem V.

description:
You're basically here because you've been grinding your heels on the ruins of old Sutro Baths. You're callousing your thumbs on a Canon Rebel and taking in the marred shoreline. And then you get hungry, and say, ever so enthusiastically, "there's a place to eat up there!" That's when you find yourself inside the doors of Louis', the most intriguingly ordinary diner ever. 

But...

Then we run into Robin Williams. You know, the wonky guy with the litany of voices Robin Williams. What bizarre, amicable timing. He's signing the guest book, bought some people lunch, and - holy toledo/expletive - he's headed right toward me. What does he want to say to me? Why is he coming over here? 

Oh, I'm just standing in front of the cash register. So I move. 

My girlfriend says, "we should take a picture with him." I lament the idea, citing the fact that it would be rude. Later, I regret this. Be polite and you live a day. Be impolite and you have a Facebook picture forever. Still, he pulsed by me and his mammoth, furry arm grazed me. I emitted the most sincere words ever, "siiiiiiiiick". 

After the great comedian left, we asked the server what Robin Williams had ordered. Apparently it had been the tuna melt with fries. We sat in the same booth he had riveted himself into, and ate this greasy, wreck of a sandwich with excitement. The food itself was diner quality. Nay. Robin Williams quality! 

Pretty good day, all said. The food was ordinary. The window seat was bliss. The weird, faux-interaction with Robin Williams intensely memorable. I cant NOT give this place four stars, right?
author: Rob P.

description: Ill give them one star for the view only. The food was a huge disappointment The omelets are priced by ingredients,so to have the omelet I wanted would have been $20.00, also the potatoes are small cubes that were deep fried with no onions, peppers or anything but salt. No choice of bread, just and English muffin, really in San Francisco, no sourdough!.My friend had sausage and eggs and the sausage was brown and serve soggy links for $12.00. No garnish on the plates, nothing! One person had coffee and the check came to $29.80!  Any restaurateur would kill for a location like that and would love to serve memorable food, but these guys have been in this location since 1937 and just don't care.I wont be back!!
author: Jimmy A.

description: Simple place, good food, great location. This is one of those diners that are hard to come by nowadays. We had an awesome brunch there on a cold and foggy day. Scrambled eggs and home fries, pancakes and bacon and muffins. Good ole' hearty diner food, nothing pretentious, reminded me of the places I used to go to as a kid in the 80s that bring back so much nostalgia. What made this place incredible however was the view. Perched high up on a hill, Louis' has the kind of view 5-star restaurants boast -- the vast Pacific just spreads out below and beyond. While we were dining we actually saw from a distance dolphins jumping and the squirt from the blowhole of a whale! Now THAT was special! I can't guarantee everyone will be lucky enough to see that but I can guarantee that you'll love the view and that the food will leave you satisfied!
author: Tracy L.

description:
The scenic joynt was founded over 73 years ago by Louis Hontalas, a Greek immigrant who opened the place on Point Lobos Avenue during the Great Depression to help make ends meet. They recently beat out three other bidders for a new 10-year lease on the property, according to the National Park Service, which owns the land.

You don't expect to find a cool retro place diner with such a magnificent view. Well maybe the old Burger King at the Presidio came close. My breakfast was basic, but good and the wait on the day I came was reasonable. Plenty of parking is available just up the hill. I also enjoyed coming early enough to avoid the Cliff House tourist bus traffic. I'll be back after they reopen after their renovations are complete.
author: Eric B.

description: We have had breakfast and lunch at this establishment, and always try to swing by when we're at Ocean Beach.  We love to eat outside over the Sutro Baths - such a great view.  I think it even makes the food taste better.  My favorite is their good ol' cheeseburger!  On the weekends it is VERY busy and you will likely have a wait, so don't go if you're in a hurry.  The food has never disappointed!
author: Debora G.

description: We stopped here to get a few waters & a couple Itsits to go while walking around the area; I have not had one in a long time, so I was in heaven as was our cousin as she had never heard of them.  The waitress was fast & friendly & I definitely want to come back here for breakfast, lunch, & dinner.  We just loved eating & drinking while viewing Seutro Towers down the street.  So, for your Itsit fix with fast friendly service, Louis' cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.
author: Brian S.

description:
Slightly less expensive alternative to the neighboring Cliff House restaurant. If you want simple basic breakfast -the stick to your ribs kind this is your place. Ask or sit in Danielle's section, she's super friendly and attentive without overdoing it. 
Oh and don't forget they only take cash.
author: Ms J K.

description:
Yeah yeah, great view, it's in SF.  I get that.  What I don't get is why a long established restaurant serves breakfast with factory made 'tator squares' and crummy Farmer John sausage and charges over 10 bucks for the pleasure?  The waitress was genuinely nice I must add.
But honestly, Louis you must be kidding.
author: Mikey A.

description: BAD FOOD! I've been to this restaurant twice and both times ordered a hamburger.  What I got for $14 was a stale white bread bun, un-toasted. On it was a minuscule meat patty that was under cooked and had no flavor. It was accompanied by french fries that somehow were both greasy and soggy. I sent the fries back and got a plate of slight less soggy fries. The only reason to to visit this place is to enjoy the view. But there are better views at the other two nearby places.
author: Paul L.

description: don't waste your time or money on this place. Service is horrible, and the food is nothing to rave about... The view is fantastic, but you can go up the hill a bit for the same view, or even down the hill to the Cliff House for the same view with much better service.
author: Cster x.

description: It needs to be said that diner food is definitely lacking in the city. I can have Chinese food any time any place anywhere in SF but American/diner food is hard to find. Luckily this place isn't too far from home and also it's on my way to the office. I typically try to go on weekdays bc weekends it's packed and I don't like to wait. Also a great place to go if cliff house bistro/breakfast is packed. The view isn't too bad either.
author: Anthony M.

description: Came here for an early family breakfast, everything was perfect...the service, the food and i' ll bet you'll love the view too. My family just love having our brunch here and we would just love to sit around having our family conversations under a time proven- family-owned, perfect getaway cafe that feels more like home than a restaurant.
author: Darby John G.

description:
I got the eggs Benedict  and it was a solid choice. The English muffin was great, fresh, full of nooks and crannys and cooked fine. The ham and eggs were cooked perfectly and there was plenty of hollandaise sauce. The potatoes that came with it were perfectly acceptable, nothing too great, nothing too bad. 
The wife got the fish and chips. To me the fish portion was a bit on the small side but the fish was actually quite tasty. Breaded and fried well with a great crunch on the outside and soft on the inside. The fries however, were a little soggy for my liking. The bread that they served  was phenomenal, it seemed freshly baked from somewhere. It was hard not to eat it all. Overall, a great diner experience, I would absolutely go back. However,   do NOT get the $5 root beer float. It is not a damn good milkshake, or a good float. It's absolutely nothing special.
author: Don P.

description: Good simple food, Excellent view, maybe a little over-priced, but not so considering S.F., and the location that comes with park regulations.  Best of all -- they are cash only -- so they get more of what I pay -- not some fat cat banker far away.  Actually, I'm upping to 5 stars for the cash only -- this will counter all the plastic loving cry babies who imagine their "rewards points" are making things cheaper.
author: Gibo M.

description:
Views are a fair reason to descend upon somewhere, and this view from this diner is worth the trek and the wait. Being that this place is less than a mile from my front door, and that it sits on the Pacific cliff, above bath house ruins, with the waves and trees and everything... is a bit astounding. 

Would you wait 20 minutes for any seat or would you wait 30 minutes for a window seat? Truly, it's a moral question. I'm a window man. I'm patient and I want what I want. And in these tourism circumstances I feel seven. So, I ordered a Malt (extra stainless steel cylinder included!), a french dip topped with an over easy egg -- dare you to try it!

On another moral point: maybe the dangling apostrophe in the title represents that the diner is dangling on the cliff as the sole business building. It's unclear whether Louis or Louis & wife opened the restaurant so I suppose the plural apostrophe is okay as they never clarified who it's named after -- but shit if it doesn't bother me still. 

Louis' is the charm of San Francisco: a straight forward diner with over priced food because you're in San Francisco -- but the view!
author: Jon A.

description: Louis Is A Great Little Place , With Wonderful   Very Picturesque Views Of The Entrance To San Francisco Bay. Ships Large And Small Go By . The Seating Is A Bit Limited , Counter Seating Available Also. Delicious Breakfasts And Lunches Served All Day.. This Is A Cash Only Establishment , ATM Available. Parking Is Unique . Outside And Up By Lands End, Across The Street By The Sutro Bathes Entrance Also . My Favorite Breakfast Is Greg's Cheesy Omelet With Chili .
author: Gregory P.

description:
Just your typical small diner...with a phenomenal view. Probably a little overpriced for what it is, but the food was good. If you like classic diner fare, it's a great cozy little place to enjoy a decent meal while overlooking Lands End and the Pacific. Definitely cheaper than the neighboring Cliff House.

Two drawbacks - it's pretty small, so be prepared to wait or share a table. And they only accept cash (but they've got an ATM next to the register that they no doubt make a fortune off of in "convenience" fees.)
author: Nicholas R.

description:
This place ain't pretendin' to be anything fancy. It's an old-school, all-American diner-type spot. I had the fried scallops and fries. I was so satisfied, as they gave me a starter salad and a huge wedge of sourdough with my meal. 

Perfect, low-key place to enjoy the view and a bite. My waitress said she's the granddaughter of the original Louis, and I love that this really is a family run restaurant. 

Random tips: The place is pretty small, so I imagine it gets crowded at peak meal times. I went at an odd hour - around 4:45pm on a Saturday - and I had to wait just 5-10 minutes for a booth with a great view. This place is also cash only, but they have an ATM. I overheard them tell some people who were just ordering drinks that there's a per person minimum (i.e. you have to order food) for the tables with the best views, which makes sense to me.
author: Kristina C.

description: Wow. What a disappointment. Louis is going way down hill. I've been coming here for over 34 years and the prices have skyrocketed while the quality has plummeted. It's wonderful that they're using free range eggs, (however they are not the best because free range is not necessary pastured so the chickens are not eating the grass and bugs as they should. The eggs here are yellow not orange. Waffles are so gross and unhealthy. Eggs Benedict are not good either. Basically food here sucks and it's a tourist trap. I doubt there are regulars who continue to go here after they raised their prices but did not raise the quality or taste of food here. Won't be back until they start serving pastured egg and meat products. Also if they could switch to organic produce, safe cooking oils, not canola or corn oil, which are OT real oils, and organic grains, they can raise the prices a tiny bit more and get more customers that live around them, that are wise to how our food should be produced and prepared. Very overpriced for what you get. This is a diner folks, let the snake oil be for the tourists. Locals avoid this place .....
author: Mary P.

description:
Here's what happens all the time right below Louis'...
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1W6AGM-LxGY

Crashing waves. Hormonal rushes..."I never knew it could be like this. Nobody ever kissed me the way YOU do." They should really wear wetsuits, don't you think? Gee, I forget we live next to an ocean. A big one. The Pacific. Ever heard of it?

I actually had never been to Louis' before last week when I stopped by for breakfast. I just figured with the view they offer that it would be a tourist trap like the Cliff House. But it's not really. It's more like a mini-Denny's but with a lot friendlier staff. The 1970's-era roadside decor may give you a clue that this is no trendy eatery.

Go on a weekday morning if you can to avoid the tourists. Only the regulars show up then, and you can have a booth all to yourself. You get quite a view of the ocean and the decrepit Sutro Baths with the wind whipping though the coastal foliage.

The menu itself is pretty standard, and it is a tad pricier than what you'd expect at a dinerish place. The price of the panorama. I had the $9.25 Sausage and Eggs Combo with hash browns and a toasted English muffin. It was all decent enough and served pretty quickly.

The place is pretty small - four booths, a few larger tables and a counter - which makes me think it fills up quickly on weekends. Between you and me, I think the food is marginally better at the Seal Rock Inn on the next corner up the winding road. But Louis' is a pleasant place to enjoy the ocean and have a cup of joe.

FOOD - 3 stars...nothing special, nothing detestable...diner fare pretty much
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...you come for the view...what else?
SERVICE - 4 stars...very friendly and accommodating
TOTAL - 4 stars...the unbeatable oceanside location is what pushes this one to four
author: Ed U.

description:
It might hurt your feelings Louis.... but you weren't my first choice. When I woke up that rainy Sunday morning and wanted a good eggs benny my first thought was Cliff House..

Situated basically hanging off a cliff and has 180 degrees of ocean which is priceless on it's own. After driving up the hill and finding it was hard to find a parking spot we drove further up the hill and found a spot right up from the jock on the block we made a last minute decision to hit up the geek instead. 

****Psss....only accepts CASH***Better bring your Benjamin's

Feeling famished we decided it was better to get right in. We sat at the counter and of course I got my eggs benny, which I judge on three things.

1. Gushing yolk (does it ooze when you pierce the skin?)
2. Is the hollandaise sauce good enough to roll your eyes back
3. Do you have enough of the good stuff to get to the last bite? 

It was a 7 out of 10. The yolk wasn't over cooked, the hollandaise was tasty but not foodgasmic and there wasn't quite enough sauce to get through til the end. It's a tough dish but I'm a tough critic. Coming from a culinary background I know what good tastes like.

I would go again. But I would suggest sitting at a booth. A lot of young staff who are pretty rambxious and they all have their personal drinks sitting on the only counter top that houses condiments and where all the food comes out of the kitchen. Knowing what I know about germs, right & wrong of the kitchen it grossed me out but for the unknowing you might not even notice.
author: Jessica M.

description:
I gotta say, I had one of the most relaxing and awesome breakfast's of my life at this place 
*purrs* ^ ^

I stopped by with a friend as we were coming back from an early early morning run, and the sun was still rising in the sky.

The waitress seated us at the window and it allowed us to watch the sunset which was stunningly beautiful.

We ordered breakfast, to which I got an onion and mushroom omelette. This omelette was soooo good. Full of flavor, perfectly cooked, and quite a big serving too! Definitely filled this cat for sure. 

The waitress was very welcoming and friendly, and it made the atmosphere of the place very nice for us.

It seem's this place gets quite busy as the day goes on, so definitely worth coming early. Very laid back and relaxed setting with the awesome view of the sunset over the ocean.

Definitely going to be hitting this place up again!

*Chirp!*
author: Jei C.

description:
I used to come here all the time with my grandparents when I was young. This place is great, the food is good, service is friendly. On a nice day you get a nice view of Sutro baths. This place has a lot of SF history to it too.

Brought my boyfriend here for lunch I had the french dip and he had the chili dog. Still delicious.
author: Kathryn Y.

description: The least exciting part of my first trip to San Francicso! Terrible customer service /server, very low quality food. I ordered a dinner salad and it was only 99% iceberg !The salad comes with butter & sourdough, but the server forgot to bring it until the end of the meal when i had to remind him! Not welcoming at all...the only good thing about this place is the great view to ocean which you can have it along with higher quality food at cliff house just around the corner!!! Dont waste your money here
author: Sahar F.

description: The worst food I ever imagined to have, low quality, bad service, very disappointed. The waiter forgot to bring the side dish, asked for extra plate and forgot to bring that too. The only positive point was the good view.
author: Ehsan R.

description: Amazing views and good food. A nice walk from our apt. on 26th Ave. We ordered bennies with a side of pancakes. Prices are reasonable and the hostess handled the hungry hungover Outsidelanders with grace and efficiency. We'll be back!
author: Lance M.

description: Talk about having a "good morning". Had a delish breakfast with fresh ingredients (quality diner food; not greasy diner, but then again it is CA..). The view is breath taking. Service was pleasant and didn't rush us even though it was a busy weekend.  Restaurant is very clean and prices just right.
author: James And Gina S.

description: I agree with all negative reviews, so, it makes no sense to repeat. 3 starts for the location and the view.
author: Elena M.

description: Do to previous yelp reviews we arrived with hesitation and low expectations but were pleasantly surprised. View are amazing and Tommy our waiter was very polite and attentive. Food was fresh and served fast 3.25 stars/add .25 service and .5 for view. Thats why i gave 4 stars.
author: Kirk D.

description:
Honestly, I don't understand how this restaurant attract repeat business.

Overpriced mediocre food in small portions. As another yelp review mentioned, the food is basically frozen pre-packaged food that's been dipped in the fryer. Example is the crinkle cut fries. I mean, I have that in my freezer right now!

Anyways, San Francisco has literally thousands of places to eat. DON'T SETTLE FOR THIS PLACE. 

Oh, and cash only? WTF?
author: F. M.

description:
Let's be honest:  You go here for the view, not the food.  

Because the food is pretty crappy.  It's super-processed, came-off-a-semi-from-some-factory-in-the-Midwest diner fare that's mediocre and seriously over-priced.  The hot chocolate comes from a packet (probably Swiss Miss or something like that) and the whipped creme on top is from a cannister and is highly processed-tasting.  The burgers are too thin to be actual handmade patties, they probably arrived to the diner frozen, and no matter how you order it, it'll come to your table medium-well.

And how about everything but the food?  The booths are crowded and cramped.  The service isn't exactly friendly.  

But you didn't come here for the food.  You came here for the view.  And it doesn't disappoint!  But honestly?  You can get a much better meal at the Beach Chalet right down the street with a similarly spectacular view for only a few bucks more.  Or if you are okay with crappy food, stop at Jack in the Box on the way to the beach, eat it on a bench with the same great view, and take a walk by Sutro Baths afterwards.  But don't bother clogging your arteries at Louis'.
author: Amy L.

description:
Action Speaks Louder than Customer Satisfaction =( 

It's a Shame when One hard Headed Wait person (Tommy)  Oh wait...He's the Manager at the "Moment" can change the outcome of a Dining Experience....
I'd like to consider myself a Level headed Individual when it comes to rating a food establishment as you can see in my previous reviews I'm a Foodie at Heart...
I'm SURE if the  Owners  Tom and Bill  Hontalas were aware how THIER guests were being treated it's be a Different story....The fact that Louis has been around for seven decades speaks for itself with the Million Dollar View.... BUT Tommy's lack of service and Compassion is dumbfounding....My Wife ordered a Patty Melt and I ordered a 
Sutro...as Usual a Minimal time went by, Our Orders came with the Crinkled Fries an  a Pickle....My Sandwich was perfect as it has been many times before....My Wife was NOT....The Patty melt was SOPPING WET with grease, she took 2 bites and Said "I can't eat this" I said c'mon REALLY ?? I took 2 bites....Whew VERY greasy---to the point of grease nearly covered my fingertip when I pressed in the center of the sandwich ..at this point I gave her the other half of my Sandwich ...Tommy finally  dropped by our table-(He seemed pre-occupied with visiting with his co-workers), asked how our meal was and My Wife told him "it's VERY greasy" He paused and said "I'm sorry about that" and without skipping a Beat, turned and walked off we looked at each other in shock.....Hmmm no apathy there...Tommy once again appeared as we were almost "finished" to re-fill our drinks....dropped our Check and before he could "Dash Off" again we told him "seriously we need this to be adjusted"....
After a Lenghy back and Forth "going no where conversation" (But you ate some of the Sandwich) we left paying the Full price with a BAD TASTE in our Mouths......    Sad thing is If a Little something was offered.. taking our Drinks off the Tab,charging us 1/2 price on the Patty Melt or charging us only for a side of Fries and a Pickle  it would have made a HUGE difference....
Customers make paydays Possible.. With a heavy heart I had to write this But if
both the Hontalas Brothers don't ever hear about it they cant Look into it...   .
author: Dave A.

description:
After the SF marathon, I was cold and starving. We drove for what felt like ages and finally arrived at this hill top cafe. I wasn't thrilled about parking midway and having to tackle yet another hill considering I had just run a marathon with nothing but steep hills but it is what it is. 

Louis' is a tiny diner. The view of the ocean will take your breath away. The hostess was friendly and understood my pain. She got us seated right away and quickly brought some water. That was very much appreciated. I was thirsty. She also brought us some hot chocolate and coffee. The hot chocolate was great; the coffee not so much but I needed the caffeine to stay awake and drank about 6 cups.

For breakfast I ordered the French Toast with a side of eggs. It wasn't gourmet french toast but I loved the powdered sugar and I was so hungry I ate it all within about 10 minutes and then sat for the next hour watching my BF eat his meal and taking occasional glances at the ocean and watching the waves as they came in.
author: Sukhraj B.

description:
I don't even care that this place is a "tourist trap" and that it's "cash-only" and that everything they use comes "pre-made or out of a bottle."  
Because - HAVE YOU SEEN THAT VIEW??

Shut up and enjoy the coffee (and bacon).
author: Rachelle P.

description: They get 1 star for the view, but go somewhere else for food. If you pay $33 for 2 burgers and a coffee and a coke, you might expect the best burger ever. You would be sorely disappointed. The meat was so dry you could barely chew it. Maybe that explains why what should have been a 1/3 lb. looked like a child's burger. It really upsets me when places fight to get saved saying they are a "service" to the City, and then they disappoint miserably. If you find yourself in this location, do yourself a favor and walk 50 feet to the Cliff House Bistro.
author: Edi M.

description: I was excited for this place but the customer treatment was handled very elementary. First of all my wife and our friends had waited over 35 mins to be seated followed an additional 20min to order..... They forgot our waters and then after had just started eating, they moved our table because we where invading another customers privacy!!!! The people next to us where clearly fine with us near them but the staff told us we cannot sit here  ( in a rude manner ) and I was like well you seated us here so what is the problem! who seats 4 ppl and and then move them while there eating?!!! Do not eat here if you have a party of 3 or more because they cannot make up there mind where you sit !!!!
author: Eric R.

description: Nice venue...out of the way, but not jive likes the wharf joints or pretentious like so much of trendoid SF.
author: Michael Z.

description: The food here isn't too bad but the prices made this restaurant a disappointing find. I enjoyed my bill's special and the chicken strips but the sandwich isn't big and you only get 3 strips. Each dish was upwards of 8 dollars so yeah, it wasn't worth the cost. Nice to see dolphins swimming down in the ocean, though.
author: Ruobin W.

description:
I absolutely ADORE this place.  Went here with a couple of friends for Sunday morning brunch.  Nothing fancy at all, simple food and simple ambiance but the view is AMAZING!

I'm definitely an eggs benedict girl and try to have it wherever I can and I know a good egg's benedict.  This place has it simple although I did try the "Louis" version.  It's with bacon instead of ham and it was simply delicious.  "Simply" emphasized here.  Definitely nothing fancy about it but it was exactly how an egg's benedict should be.

The only downside is that it's pretty small but doesn't seem super busy for it's location.  We waited about 10 mins for a table.  I also had my two little dogs so I tied them up to the white picket fence outside and was able to watch them from inside the restaurant.  Loved seeing all the people walk by and pet them.

Overall, just a great brunch spot.  Will definitely be back for the benedict and view.
author: Kay R.

description: Great view but horrible food. DONT EAT THERE, just order a drink if you need to pass by. Quality worse than fast food.
author: Catherine S.

description:
Food - meh. View - BEAUTIFUL.

Location. Location. Location. This place has it. RIght next to Ocean Beach, you can go for a walk/run, hang out with the family, or just read a book on this beautiful beach. And just up the hill is the Cliff House and Louis'. Cliff House is pricey, but worth every penny. They have amazing views, and even an outdoor area (not for dining) where you can walk around and take pictures. Louis', reasonably priced food, friendly staff, and it get's REALLY busy. Don't let the long line fool you, the food is below average. Much like diner food (Denny's or Lyons). We ate here for the first time last Saturday, and we won't be back.
author: D M.

description:
First time here yesterday for a quick lunch w/hubby.

watched as a woman sitting w/her grandson poured the ketchup, LICKED the bottle, replaced the cap and continued her meal.

eeeeew.

Our food was good, nothing exceptional, but we weren't expecting much, just a good lunch.

wrote them an email about the licking. Wonder what they'll do.
author: Stella D.

description:
This place was a disappointment especially because I wanted it to be good so I could make it a regular lunch spot. My takeaway was that this place rides on the fact that they will probably always get business from people stopping to look at the menu at The Cliffhouse and then swiftly running in the opposite direction (don't get me wrong, love the food at The Cliffhouse but the prices are laughable. $30 for 3 scallops and a tiny scoop of Israeli couscous? no.) SO anyway, this place knows it will appeal to somebody who wants to pay less for lunch so they still overcharge- just not as much. I ordered the shrimp louie salad. This salad has no write to be called a Louie. Scattered on a small plate, it had iceburg lettuce, a small portion of bay shrimp, one hard boiled egg, halved and 2 thin slices of tomato, on the side there was (brace yourself) BOTTLED Thousand Island dressing... my co-luncher ordered the fish and chips... shaking my head..... disappointing doesn't cover it... I want to say I'm a little disgusted. For OVER SIXTEEN STUPID DOLLARS!!!! he got 2 grease-laden pre-breaded and frozen pieces of fish which lay in a pool of oil and some fries. I will say the tartar sauce was good, the saving grace if there was one. Oh I forgot, he got a cup of "manhattan clam chowder" before his fish and I just have one question about this soup: Does Campbells make large cans of that soup or do you have to open one can for every 2 cups you serve? That might amount to a lot of cans... 
Oh and the soda is Pepsi yuck AND IT'S $3.25 FOR A GLASS PEOPLE! 

So the bitter icing on the poor quality, overpriced cake was they are cash only but they generously provide an atm where you are forced to pay a fee to get money to pay. Now, I come prepared to most places that they might be cash-only but not a place where you're spending almost $20 a plate for lunch. I bet that ATM makes a killing because the average prudent person wouldn't think a place like this is cash only and furthermore, a lot of people may not carry THAT much cash on them.  My advice: drive a little further up the street and eat at the Seal Rock Inn.
author: Emma H.

description: 10 out of 10 would come again. Brand new menu item Benedict's are delicious! I came wanting biscuits and gravy, which they unfortunately don't serve, but did not leave hungry or disappointed. Great service and a stunning view. Come check it out in the outer Richmond!
author: Taylor R.

description: A beautiful view and great diner food for a decent price. The staff are all very friendly and conversational and the service is very speedy. I ordered the BLT which was a simple comfort meal and was very delicious. The root beer float is awesome as well!
author: Devin C.

description: great view while eating brunch... i got their french toast original very good... good for a weekend brunch
author: Gladys D.

description:
I really wanted to like this place but my experience today has got me to swear off this family run spot. I now remember going there years ago and not thinking it was bad, and my food was decent today until I cut into my eggs benedict and found what I hope was the hair off a cook's head and not somewhere else. 

How many starts do you take away for a thick black hair in your breakfast? 

I know things like this can happen but it really made me lose my appetite and the apology was so half-assed that I don't think they really cared that much, they were busy with a vendor or something. 

Too bad they didn't make a better effort to apologize for a bad food experience I work very close by and I won't be recommending them to any or my customers or co-workers. 

Yeah, yeah, great view, pleasant wait staff, but that doesn't make up for the food they served me.
author: Richie C.

description:
One star for the food (which is more than it deserves), and one star for the view (which, like many others have said, is phenomenal).

The food here is so bad. Worse than any greasy spoon that I've been to in SF, and I've been to quite a few of them. I don't usually hold greasy spoon diner-style places to a higher regard, but when I'm paying 150% price premium, I expect better automatically.

The Hollandaise was awful. Like it was from a can or packet.

The eggs were overcooked.

The potatoes were flavorless and not crispy at all.

I think the worst part of the pricing aspect is that this place is STILL cash only. I mean, really? 2012? Cash only? That's just some bean-counting manager being a dick. Oh, but there's an ATM! And they totally don't have any vested interest in that, right?!?! Uh huh.

Spend a little more money (or even the same?!) at Cliff House, or go to the Seal Rock Inn and get better food. You might luck out and get one of the four tables with a good view.

Avoid this place. I don't know how it hasn't gone out of business 10 times over.
author: Cody K.

description:
Time spent by Ocean Beach, Sutro Bath House and Land's End would ultimately peak my interest with Louis' as the small restaurant along the paved path, and I knew I would eventually have to swing by and try it at least once.

Breakfast is the predominant item on the menu and with such a great view, who wouldn't want to start their mornings here. Tables line building giving you window access, while the bar seats you facing the friendly staff of Louis'. 

Classic Eggs Benedict listed $12.95 with thinly sliced ham, poached eggs on a muffin covered with hollandaise sauce was paired with potatoes and I was ready to dig in after heating up my food with some hot sauce. It was a good meal with friendly staff and a great view so another star is given.

I would come back on an early morning if I find myself strolling along the beach or taking a hike on the trails.
author: Casey L.

description: I don't even want to rate it any stars. But one star just so I can post this.  One bad rude service. And I worked in the food industry and they could have handle it in a better way. But they chose to be rude and moved our seat, we didn't even get our order or WATER in what seems like forever the minutes-and more we had sat down. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. Sad because am really not the type to write bad review but this would be the first.
author: Franny A.

description:
Great views, which probably deserve at minimum 3 stars, as well as the waitress was helpful. 

If only I could say the same for the greeter. I mean early 20 somethings that talk like there in an episode of "Vanderpump" blah be blahs.. if thats your style, well... sat in the uncomfortable 2 chair waiting area becaise she refused to serve me because I was waiting for another person.. okay fine, I didnt complain. 

The food was mediocre at best! No creativity, plain, ordinary, and small boring portions! I think that describes it best. Breakfast food was simply boring! I wasn't expecting 4 star dining either.. Order the Mushroom and chedder omelette and you will understand. 

I'm giving Louie one star because the waitress was friendly and kept the coffee coming that allowed for conversation with my friend.
author: Devon H.

description:
Beautiful view, that you definitely pay for. The food isn't bad, but it isn't good.  All prepackaged junk.  Fries, premade patty burgers, on white toast kinda joint.  Expect this maybe outside of Reno, but not next to the Suttro Baths in San Fran.  

Cash-only, and $12 for something that costs more like $2 anywhere but here.  I just wanted to grab a bite before hiking in the headlands. I suppose I had no choice..
author: Brandon T.

description:
Went here to dodge from the rain and to grab a warm bowl of soup, while my BF decided to indulge in a glass of milkshake (did I mention it was raining and cold : ) )   

Well, first of all, have to get this out of my system. If you want to feel good about your writing or if you know of a friend who is having a writer's block, casually ask them to flip to the back of Louis' menu and you will instantly feel good about anyone's writing, except maybe's louis, or whoever Louis asked to writing that piece of so call history.

Service was not good, the head waitress was scary to not only the customers but apparently to the other waitress as well.  

The bathroom is all the way in the back and avoid it at all cost, trust me, you really don't want to use it, unless you are trying out the whole barf aftering eating routine.

Since I only ordered soup and fries, can't say how their food is like, but judging from how they make the soup and it's clam chowder, their food is probably not that good either.  

I am not being harsh, i am simply being honest.  Unless you are a tourist and you don't know any better, than do your stomach the justice and go to a real restaurant.
author: Young N.

description:
I've always wanted to come here... and finally we came out here on a Sunday for brunch. I thought the food was above average and even a little marginal towards the good side -- I'd really give a 3.5 but Yelp...

The wait time for a party of 6 was about 60 minutes (yeah, it gets packed) but I managed to chat up one of the National Park volunteer and some tourists, so time went by pretty quick. At this point, 'd also like to give credit to the waitress for coming out of her way to come look for me, given that I had hiked *slightly* away from the restaurant. 

The restaurant itself is somewhat smaller than what I imagined from usually seeing it from the street, but the view is -- as always for Land's End and Ocean Beach -- breathtaking. You could also sit over the counter, I didn't notice any difference in the level of service and I suppose the wait time might even be shorter. 

I know I'll come back here if and when I'm playing host to tourists, or whenever I feel like one.
author: Kevin N.

description:
Like a simple, home-style, average, local diner wrapped in awesome.

Strolled in a little after 10AM on a Saturday after a nice, quiet nature walk. This area is definitely a before10AM kind of place; anything after that and your fighting with the Saturday morning crowd. 

We only waited 5 minutes for a window seat table, and at the time, we were the only ones waiting. Service was quick. I had 2 eggs over easy, and 2 pancakes and everything was quite normal. I would have ordered some sausage, but that was something like a 5 dollar premium. Prices are steep, but the view definitely makes up for it.

About 20 minutes after we sat down, the front door was PACKED with folks looking to dine. 

If you want a nice meal and an even better view, wake up a few minutes earlier and get to Louis'!
author: John C.

description: Ugh / black hair in the food, eggs over easy runny, bacon all fat - save your cash for another diner this place is horrid!!
author: JL B.

description: Fast service, great food and amazing price for its ocean front location. It is on top of The Sutro Baths...
author: Danielle S.

description:
Weak Sauce.


Poor quality diner food. (lunch)

Exceptional view.

Lunch:
Fish n Chips:    B-
4pc. Decent but should offer more quality-quantity for being on the ocean!  Frozen bag wrinkle cut French fries.

Prawns n Chips:    B
Not bad fried prawns, but still felt like came from a package with the wrinkle cut French fries....

Louie Salad:  C
Not terrible, but expensive for some Bay shrimp on iceberg lettuce along with 2 sliced tomatoes that are cut for burgers and sandwiches (nice cost cutting strategy Louis... I'm sure rents expensive, but if you really want to make a name for yourself, get your act together on food quality). No Crab?  Don't even offer??

Iced coffee: F
normal poor quality diner coffee with ice in it..

Juice: all from concentrate....


Although a rich history of being owned by family, etc. this place does NOT deserve to be in this location...Quality of food is poor.  Soak in the view from outside and brown bag it baby.....



Breakfast looked a bit better, but still overpriced for the location and view.
author: Mark M.

description:
It doesn't get much better than the view from Louis'.  Up on the bluffs, with stunning, panaoramic views of the Pacific Ocean.  You can see most of Ocean Beach and a little peak of Marin County.  It's unreal.  

The restaurant itself is an unpretentious little diner with decent food and reasonably priced.  It's not the kind of place you'd expect to find on that kind of real estate, which, in my opinion, is part of what makes the place so amazing.  

I've been a few times over the last 15 years or so.  Having just moved to the City from Hawaii, I went back to Louis'  for dinner last week with some out-of-towners.  Good food (I had the fish and chips), although we were a little bummed we couldn't order breakfast for dinner.  Still, good food and a generally good experience.  Service was a little slow, but not abysmal.  Definitely recommend checking this place out.
author: Erin W.

description:
Awful experience. Stay away if you have young children. We felt very unwelcomed and were ignored. They insisted they only had space left at the bar when there were empty tables or where two tables could easily be joined together for a table of 4. Then didn't allow us to put the carseat on a dining chair. Thereafter ignored us when it came to taking our orders.  We walked out in the end!

We have given a star since they could have been far more rude I guess!
author: Sean L.

description: Funny story, you show up on a Tuesday morning when the restaurant is near empty and they will refuse to seat you if your entire party is not present. OK, policy is policy, but when the young man a the counter says they will not serve you their mediocre food because not everyone is there makes it a problem. Your restaurant is empty and we were ready to order, I guess our money (cash only too) is no good there. This does not even get into the young man that gave us smug attitude and remained leaning against the counter top as if we were disturbing his conversation. I have been here several times, but will never return. If you want attitude, average food, and a nice view try here. Otherwise you are better off eating breakfast at the Cliff House where they know how to treat people and have a better view.
author: Kyle B.

description:
Poor service and food.

What more should I say

Worst food I've had in San Francisco in 2014. 

Real shame. Waiters make u feel sorry for being there.
author: adithya j.

description: Other than the view, this place wasn't anything terribly special.  It's a small place, cash only.  Breakfast is on par with any Diner.  Would I go back? Most definitely but I wouldn't go out of my way just to go here.
author: Tony T.

description: We went for brunch, nice choice, good price, nice portions, nice service, amazing view. We ll go back.
author: Laura D.

description:
This has been a favorite place of mine since I moved to San Francisco six years ago. It's a great place to go before or after a hike at Land's End or down to Ocean Beach.

They've recently completed a remodel and the exterior looks great. The staff is and always has been super nice and quick to help. I hate saying this because I love this place so much but I sometimes get the feeling that the food isn't exactly home made. I'll leave it at that...

What this place lacks in high end food it sure makes up for with a view that will take your breath away. Maybe that's the secret: Keep them staring out the windows and they won't even know what they're eatin'. 

It's still a place I will always go to and I wish I could give a 3.5 rating here.
author: Gabriel R.

description: The view is awesome and worth the wait for a seat, but the food is nothing to write home about.  We ordered the chicken strips and fries. They looked and tasted like frozen food you could cook at home. Everything in San Francisco is expensive, but be prepared to be paying for the view more so than the quality of food.
author: Katelyn A.

description: Good food, excellent service and views, nice place, plenty of parking.  If you don't like long waits, don't come at busy times.  There's a reason folks are inside enjoying themselves.
author: John K.

description:
They do not accept credit cards, which I find annoying.  

Their red clam chowder is delicious.  It is what they are known for.  I would go back for that soup.

I also ordered the burger and it was okay.  I thought it was going to be a delicious diner burger, but it was not worthwhile and the fries were eh.  

The view is great!  And it is easily accessible to Land's End hiking/walking trails.  Great place to eat with a beautiful view and then go for a nice stroll.
