The place is small so it is not ideal for groups although they will accommodate that.  I would not go with more than 4 people unless you are willing to wait a really long time.

The prices are reasonable and affordable.
author: Vagabond V.

description:
Like a cheap greasy diner, only not cheap. 
Go down the hill, spend $5 more for an entree and enjoy the food.
author: janice n.

description: One of my all-time favorite places to go again, and again.  Beautiful location and good food.  Not fantastic food, just good food and friendly people.  You know what you're getting here and the food is priced right.  The eggs benedict was VERY tastey.
author: Kelly R.

description:
I would definitely give the view five stars because it IS pretty wonderful.

I had been trampling around the old Sutro Bath ruins for about four hours, taking tons of various angle pics when I realized my blood sugar was low. That, and it was FREEZING out, so I thought that a hearty bowl of clam chowder sounded good. 

I forged my way up the embankment to Louis', looked over at the Cliff House, contemplated the walk over there and then just decided to grab something at Louis since I was so close. I think I should have made the walk to Cliff House.

It was approximately 4pm on a shitty, overcast, freezing cold Friday, so there weren't many people around. I chose a booth with a good view, although it was dirty. The waitress was okay, nothing extraordinary, although she wasn't very good at her job. 

To my dismay, they only had Manhattan Clam Chowder, which has a tomato base. I was hoping for a creamy New England, but oh well. It's a good sized bowl and comes with a clump of sourdough and some butter. 

The soup tasted like a salty tin can. NOT IMPRESSED. I forced it down and then thought that a piece of cheesecake might get that taste out of my mouth. The waitress comes back over and I tell her these exact words: "I think I'm gonna try a piece of cheesecake. Does that come with a topping?"

She says yes, strawberry or chocolate syrup. I then tell her "Strawberry sounds good, I'm thinking I'm gonna do that." 

So I sit and wait for my cheesecake. And wait. And wait. And then wait some more. She finally comes back over and asks me if I would like anything else. I said "yeah, the cheesecake." 

It was good cheesecake, but their service blows ass. The wait staff act as though they don't want to be there. Perhaps it was just that day, who knows. They ARE a bit pricey for a diner and for the quality of food they serve.

I honestly don't think Louis would be proud to have his name on the place these days. Go for the view, just don't get the chowder. I saw some people enjoying a French dip, perhaps that's a better choice?
author: Eyva Kid C.

description:
One star for the view and another for the service.

Another co-worker dinner adventure! We were waiting for this place to open up again so we could finally try it. The place has a pretty sweet view of the Sutro Baths and part of the seagull shit stained rocks aka Seal Rocks.

The menu is pretty typical. You got your omelettes, salads, etc etc and my co-worker suggested we both get steaks. I was down for big slab o' meat so that's what we went with. It comes with either salad or soup. I got the soup (Manhattan clam chowder, the tomato based one!) and he got the salad. The chowder was salty as HAYYYYLLL. I practically diluted it with my water. My co-worker's salad was just...a salad with minimal dressing, overflowing on a tiny coffee saucer they used as the plate. No biggie. It was rather fun watching him poke at tomatoes as they rolled off the small plate.

Here comes the worst part aka the entree/steak. Absolutely flavorless. Ok, maybe we're supposed to season it ourselves because that's how some people like to do but still! Also, we ordered it medium rare and it came out well done like REALLY well done, rougher than alligator skin, accompanied by standard frozen and cooked right of the bag crinkle cut fries. Oh well, at least they got the grill marks on the steak right. 

Our server was nice and also really apologetic when we told him about the steaks. He offered to have it exchanged for us but that would be a hassle anyway. Its not his fault that the cook sucks lol; 

I see some good reviews here so I'm willing to try it again but be warned: DON'T GET THE STEAK!!
author: KD M.

description: One of the most memorable places I've been to in San Fran. A native recommended this diner and although the food wasn't as memorable as the view it's worth the trek. The dishes aren't as bad as what people make of it honestly. Just bear with the average platters and you'll do just fine. Oh hey, look, seals!!!!!!!
author: Helen C.

description: Awful food, burnt toast, mediocre service but an incredible view. Probably not worth it.
author: Caity Y.

description:
I would love to love this place.  I am a neighbor and can see them from my front window.    but alas.Here is a list of my gripes:

1) greasy spoon diner food.  for some this is a plus.  The potatoes were squares that felt reheated from last night.  The omelet was grainy and runny.Yes, they were free range eggs.  Oviously they were running on my plate.

 Did I mention that the plain omelet starts at 8.95  add $1 for  cheese, 1.25 for mushrooms and 1.50 for bacon.   add that up  and that is expensive for mediocre at best food.  no bueno.

Check this morning for 1 omelet, one short stack and 2 coffees? plus tip? $30.    I dont mind paying $30 bucks, but it has to be good.

2) I know it is a family run business, but please keep your business  problems  private.  I heard the apparent owner, or  person running the shift  whining about  how some staff member was in no shape to work and that she has to be written up.  Really?  If I am I overpaying for the stunning view, at least let me be in peace. and not hear the petty dramas.  

3)Yes, the view is stunning... but  in no way justifies the price.  In the future  I will just get a cup of coffee  and walk the bluffs.

As a neighbor, i waited a long time for the new renovated Louis'.  I didn't like it before but tried it again just to see the improvement.   Prices are higher and  the food is no better.  

I just hope that the new warming hut that is going in next door will force them to reinspect their menu.

Ultimately, the biggest issue I have is the fact that there is so much potential for this place and they just dont reach any of it.  I would love the family to really own the cuisine of San Francisco.  They could really do great food, charge double and still fill the place everyday.
author: maia j.

description:
Been going here for years - but was disappointed with the really lousy service here on Tuesday. Same staff as ever - but they were pretty busy visiting with  each other and not so attentive to the needs of the customers. And they seated a single person at a huge table - huge party at a small table . . . it was kind of a disaster. 

The food isn't that great - my "over medium" eggs had runny whites? And they still refuse to substitute anything - like a pancake instead of the potatoes . . . .  It's just an over priced fry cook joint - with a million dollar view.
author: Janet K.

description:
Not a kid friendly place and staff couldn't be more inexperienced.  Went this morning with 2 mommy friends and our three 3 year olds.  We were quoted 20 minutes by a young 20 something, and waited over 40 min.  When we moved to the first available table for 6, staff were very rude to us.  

The hostess, wait staff and manager all very young could not of been more intolerant, unsympathetic and unprofessional in manner.  We were denied the table despite having waited for a 6 person table over 40-45 min.  Food looked like average american comfort food. 

Go to Park or Beach chalet down the block for service, food, atmosphere, view and a good time.
author: christine J.

description: Much better after the remodel! Great place to bring dates. I can't speak much for the food but the milkshakes are my favorite by far. The views are spectacular no matter the time of day or the weather. They have done a few things to improve their Eco footprint and become more ADA compliant and the windows let in much more light. Worth checking out with friends or dates. Thanks Louis!
author: Jim L.

description: Great view! Very good waffle! Cash Only! Eggs cooked well. Hot chocolate very rich. No mochas or espresso. Great view!
author: C J.

description:
I remember this place as a kid when Playland at the Beach and The Sutro Baths were thriving and the whole area was hopping with food and amusement spots.  It's a place you dive by more than visit and murmur, we shold try Louis' again, it's been too long, but you never do.   My best friend was visiting from Chicago and my lover from Boise and we were out and about playing tourists and decided to grab lunch there on a recent, sunny, midweek October afternoon.  We were seated at the counter which was fine and I chose to have their 'Frenchburger' which almost universally means a half pound patty on some kind of a french roll.  Louis' didn't deviate from the norm and soon enough I had a white oval platter with a toasted open face french roll crowned by a decent size patty covered in melting cheese. a pile of crinkle cut fries and some so so lettuce, tomato, onion and pickle.  

The place has been there more than 70 years and isn't fancy or even swell, but it's not inexpensive either.  Like most San Franciscans, I don't expect much out what I call tourist trap restaurants and this is no exception for me, so no expectations translates into no great disappointments either.  From the counter where we were seated the only view is the slit peering into the kitchen or the derrieres of the many busy waitresses, not an all bad experience but not as sweet as seal rock and the wide open Pacific Ocean on a fine, sunny October day.  Most of the menu is classic diner food and gives the feel and appearance of coming from cans and frozen packages, or an uninspired kitchen, but it is fine grub for the throngs of hungry tourists who clamor for a seat in this long standing tourist trap.  It's fun and interesting.
author: Stu S.

description:
Love the view! Service is horrible. I've been here 3 times. Twice dressed up professionally after work and once on my day off where I look like a street kid. Regardless of how I dress I should receive the same service and here I DID NOT! I will never return to this place, unless I need to sneak in to go pee after a hike or spending time at the beach. 

Veggie burger  and greek salad are AMAZING but the burger comes with  gross fries that come straight from the freezer and look like something that was served to me in elementary school lunch. Gross...

The only plus to this place is the view, and reading about the Sutro  history on the menu. 

Eff this place...


CASH Only, but they have an ATM inside
Seating is limited. If you go at a busy time you could wait up to 30 mins
author: GEL C.

description:
We always enjoyed louies and were dissappointed when they closed down for renovations.  We liked going for breakfast and even though the food was so so we could soak in the view with our eggs and coffee.

Well, they finally finished the renovatuon, we went back and what a dissapointment.  The food was awful.  We had guests with us and were so embarrased.  The fish and chips were straight out of a box, breakfast potatoes were little dry squares  (frozen) that tasted like day old out of the fridge.  Just awful. 

The view, however, is stll spectacular.  It's clear that Louies has decided not to make an effort with their food since they have this view.  I think they're wrong.  Their business will suffer and we will not be back.  We'll go to the cliff house from here on in.  Hungry tourists beware.
author: Holland J.

description:
What Louis' lacks in other areas, it makes up for with the view. You just can't beat it. 

It's basically just a small, family-owned diner. I think the higher prices are because they get all their food local and organic, which is nice. I've been for breakfast there twice and I would definitely recommend their omelets. 

It's a great experience to try - maybe not the best food you've ever had, but a beautiful little place!
author: Brianne H.

description:
Hey, the view is 5 stars!

This is a throw-back to days gone by, one of the reasons I love this place.  It is a favorite of mine for breakfast.  Get there early, you'd never know it was a tourist-heavy spot later in the day.  IN fact, all I've ever had here is breakfast, but it is great to watch the ocean and relax prior tot he start of the day.

the food is pricey, but  I'm sure they have big overhead, or at least that's how I justify the prices I pay.   

Check it out...I think you'll like it.
author: Bill B.

description: Wonderful service great views. This place is very welcoming and makes you feel at home. Great French dip sandwich and great fries. Overall great stop while visiting Sutro Baths.
author: Andreanna H.

description: Five stars would be if this place were open at better hours. Stopped in here a couple weekends ago with a friend. We got there probably around ten am and I kind of expected to have to wait. We walked in and were seated right away in what I think is the prettiest booth in there. The views are beautiful. Where else can you eat breakfast and see pelicans and seals and dolphins and coyotes in their natural habitat going about their day? The prices are bearable and the food was good. Service was good too. CASH ONLY. also DO NOT LEAVE ANYTHING VALUABLE IN YOUR CAR. People get their cars broken into all the time here even though the neighborhood is just fine. I think its because of tourists coming here all the time and leaving things in the car. Do not disregard the signs and do not leave stuff in the car. That includes the trunk.
author: Yolanda Y.

description:
The view and service is a five stars.   The food is a three star.  We had the  veggie (tomatoes, mushrooms, spinach) eggs Benedict which were  great except for the hollandaise sauce (canned?) and the french toast (over cooked a bit)

A great spot to stop after hiking thru lands end.   The  escape from Alcatraz triathlon was today, and the bike ride portion was right outside their door.  It was hot today, but views were spectacular!

Full monty (good story, bad acting) last night and  voca People tonight.
author: Foodlover B.

description: Food was decent. Classic diner food. Nothing special. They only take cash, which when tracking expenses for business travel is fun.  If you want to spend a little more, the Cliff House down the road has an even better view and 10x better food.
author: Jason F.

description:
Amazing place for a typical American breakfast near the ocean! Having in mind how few breakfast places there are where you can see the sunrise while having a nice cup of coffee and pancakes, Louis' certainly gets my five stars. I have been there many times and the food has always been really good. Nothing too special or fancy, but great pancakes, waffles and eggs.

The service is OK, sometimes I feel like there are too many kids serving: on different occasions different kids have spilt my juice on the table, but I guess that is also part of the charm. It's kind of annoying and old fashioned that they don't take credit cards, but come on: that view and peacefulness and the simple diner atmosphere are worth the effort of withdrawing cash beforehand.
author: Anellia I.

description:
I hate that they are currently closed for renovations! This is my favorite place to get breakfast in the entire city. 

The wait times are long, the meals are a tad pricey and flies always hover over us at our tables. They are cash only with a high fee ATM inside. But the food is heavenly! So they get five stars. 

If your food rocks, nothing else matters. 

Oh and parking is easy peasy and free. Plus the views are amazing no matter where you sit. Finally, the staff is always super friendly! 

I miss this place. I wish they'd re-open already. I want breakfast!
author: Kamel P.

description:
A greasy spoon with a view.
The most interesting thing on the menu was the history of the establishment. Terrific view of the ocean and sutro baths but this is not a place to go if you want to set your taste buds on fire. Staff were pleasant and the food was good but unremarkable. I had the eggs Benedict which was ok but eggs were requested poached soft but arrived over done.
If you like drinking wine out of tiny screw top bottles then this is for you!

Not a bad place to go if you want breakkie by the ocean before yo go walk Lincoln park ( which I recommend)
author: Adam O.

description: One star is for the view.  the other star is for the fact that it opens earlier than my kids wake up.  as for the rest, pretty average.  i don't think they have ever remembered the side of bacon i ordered.  and i am not sure what sort of nepotism goes on here, but when i am paying forty bucks (cash only) for two omelets and a cup of coffee, i ask that you please keep your attitude problem to yourself.  Not naming any names, but it rhymes with Lennifer and it starts with a J.  don't carry around a cloud, lady.
author: Julia K.

description:
My brother introduced me to this place when I was really young. We would always spend an afternoon in the city and started it with a good breakfast at Louis'.
Since then I go when I can, but I order the same thing since I was little... LOL.
I have some waffles and a hot chocolate... simple but very good.

We always got seats by the window because you get a great view of the pacific ocean, the cliffs and you can even see where the sutro baths used to be. Even though this place is really small, it gets very very busy. 

BRING A JACKET! You will be waiting outside. If you dont' know what it's like being oceanside in SF, it gets very cold and windy unless you get really lucky and its warm and sunny day.

Parking is not a problem because they have a small lot directly across the street.
But if it gets full, you can find parking along the street up or downhill from the restaurant.

The other great thing about this restaurant is it's location. You can go down to see the Sutro Baths or walk downhill and you will find the Cliffhouse and the beach. Down the road is also Beach Chalet restaurant, Golden Gate Park and the SF Zoo.
author: Luis O.

description:
I'm a local, but like other people I was in the area to wander around the Sutro Bath ruins. Afterward, we walked past Louis' and noticed the place was almost completely empty. I've lived in the San Francisco area my whole life (59 years) and NEVER was there no waiting line to get in -- so we did.

I can't remember what I had for lunch, but the milkshake was really good. As most others here agree, the view is fantastic. As some here have mentioned, the rest room IS very tiny.

At the time we were there, Louis' was facing closure because of the lease renewal. We had a very good and pleasant conversation with our waitress about it -- and it was heartbreaking, too. So, seeing the place is still open is very good news to me.
author: Nick C.

description:
Every Little Breeze seems to whisper Louie...a special SF mom and pop shop. 

This place goes back to the 1930's...try their eggs benedict ...yum. It's a diner, so bring plenty of cash$.  I'd come back again....next biz trip.
author: J-Pierre E.

description: Unbelievably beautiful setting, great brunch food at a good price.
author: Rajvi B.

description:
One of the best breakfast places in San Francisco that I've ever been to.  Not only do they have a wide selection of plates, but all the ingredients seem fresh and organic.  I stuck with my usual two eggs, ham steak, potatoes, and toast breakfast, but I kept eying the various eggs benedict offerings they had.

I can completely see why this place is such an institution in the neighborhood as I would be a repeat offended if I lived any closer.  I'm definitely looking forward to coming back to sample the rest of their menu.
author: Mojo S.

description:
Oof. I had heard of San Francisco being, in general, a pricey city to visit. For the most part, I had no problem with that. This is one of those places, though, that's unjustifiably expensive.

I went there with my family--four of us in all. I saw that this place had good reviews and it was right by the Sutro Baths, which was going to be our next stop.

I won't go into what each of us ate, suffice to say it was all breakfast items and it was about as mediocre as you can get. I should say that I actually really love diners. Any time there is a chance to hit a diner, I'm all over it. But this place was just blah.

The food itself is 3 stars--not horrible, not good. Just functional, I suppose.

I took away a star for the prices. We wound spending over $80 (breakfast and juice/coffee per person, plus tip). It was disappointing. Whereas I was happy to pay the inflated rates at many other restaurants around the city, this one just really pissed me off.

The bright side, I will say, is the gorgeous view of the ocean and the Sutro Baths. Save yourself the money and just take pictures outside of the restaurant.
author: Kelli P.

description:
the best spot for a good breakfast with a spectacular view.

It's all about the view. You can see up the Marin headlands to Pt. Reyes, and the ruins of the old Sutro Bath House. Get there early, or be prepared to be patient. This is a local hangout that also attract tourists.

Breakfast runs $8-10, and it's American diner fare. The burgers are generous, and aren't cooked to shoe leather. Good fries. Friendly staff.

There is free parking in a small lot across the street.

Take a stroll along Land's End after you eat to enjoy the many views (and walk off a few calories).
author: Monarch B.

description:
Big disappointment. Was looking forward to a simple, nice diner meal but I wouldn't return to the restaurant or recommend it. We arrived just before 6 pm and they closed at 6:30 pm. It seemed like the staff didn't care about anyone, and they just wanted to get off of work

(-)
- Dirty: the floor was dirty, dishes were piled up on the counter where customers could have sat
- Lack of structure/management: we weren't greeted at the door and didn't know whether or not to seat ourselves. The servers talked among themselves attempting to figure out which customers sat themselves but ultimately the servers weren't monitoring the front door
- Poor customer service: nearly all of the servers looked miserable. They gave us our drinks and food without smiling or even looking at us
- Cash only: but does have an ATM inside
- Closes at 6:00 pm

(+)
- Has a really nice view 
- The food is pretty good
author: Kristina S.

description:
I went there with 2 of my friends that came from France since they wanted to try American style food, and be near the coast.
So as soon as we get there their is a waiting line but the host take our name right away, and they were very welcome. so we get sat at a corner booth which was perfect and the view was amazing. It was beautiful.
Finally, we decide on what we want after reading the menu, i decided to get a grill cheese, and they decided to get Hamburger. 
They both ordered their burger well done and they were perfectly cooked and moist. They loved their fries. So they were satisfy with their meal, the whole American burger experience was a success. However, i was not a big fan o the sandwich, the grill cheese was too greasy and i was not impressed by the fries.
Anyway, i was not complaining because the view was so amazing.

OVERALL, the service was great and pleasant. The server always came an checked on us. The portion were great, for the price. I would recommend this place if you guy are around the cliff house, its really ideal and good food overall. Their salad looked amazing, may i will get that next time and stay away from the cheese.
author: Sonia D.

description: Went on a Monday with some  friends, and there is still a waiting line for a table for 4, even though it was a weekday.  Waited for 15 mins, and since this restaurant only has one floor, you should plan on waiting awhile for a table! If you're not so picky, I suggest sitting at the counter; however, the disadvantage is not being able to have face-to-face conversation with your friends... Meanwhile, the food or lunch menu is at best mediocre. All my friends had some type of cheeseburgers, and I had the roast beef/ham/cheese sandwich on sourdough w/fries, but I asked for a "bunless" sandwich, and they made it my way. Although the portion size of meal was sufficient, I'm not sure if the quality of food was authentic, and what I'm referring to is their French fries- very bland and they seem like the frozen variety.  I'm happy to say that waiters were pleasant, but not as attentive as I would have liked. On a positive note...there is a magnificent view of the Sutro baths, Sutro park, Cliff house, Ocean beach and LandsEnd trail; maybe that is what justifies the high prices of food given that this is a 'touristy' place to dine. But if you want quality food, pay more elsewhere! One more thing: this place only accepts cash, so be prepared!
author: Vanessa B.

description:
Ah, Louis'...  This is a really fun spot.  Incredible views of the Pacific, with the cozy charm of a Mom & Pop diner.  

The food, while a buck or two higher than it should be, was perfectly edible, and the slightly higher cost is more than made up for in ambiance.

Expect a wait on a weekend or during the lunching hour.  Avoid the pie.  Not so good.

Great place to bring visiting friends and family for a meal with a view - especially one that spares your wallet from the terrors of the Cliff House down the street.
author: Peter M.

description: Great view! This is a little diner style restaurant with a Classic American menu. Burgers, grilled cheese, hot dogs, etc.  The food is yummy, but kind of pricey for what it is.  Aside from the price, this is a great little place!
author: Janelle P.

description: I wanted to love this place.  The views are spectacular, and they offer a vegan burger!  Unfortunately, the service was the worst I've had in a restaurant in a long time.  We sat at the bar, so while we waited almost 10 minutes for someone to acknowledge us, we got to hear the staff talk about the crazy keg party they were planning, how f***ed up they got the night before, and how hungover they were.  We also got to enjoy the staff arguing with each other loudly the entire time, very professional!  When my food arrived, there was a hair on my fries.  I got no apology, just an eye roll from the surly waitress and "we'll get you new fries."  My second plate sat in the window for over ten minutes, while multiple staff members walked by it over and over again.  So sad that such a great location has such incompetent staff.  Very disappointing.
author: Laura S.

description: Great view of the bath house from any seat in the diner.  Eggs Benedict were great!  Good service although make sure to bring cash.  They do have an atm but charges a coupe of dollars per transaction.
author: Victor D.

description:
Million dollar view this Saturday around 5PM - just fantastic.  Everything else?  Completely mediocre.

Restaurant is half empty, but we have to wait 10 minutes til they can accommodate our party of four.  Place is totally run down and needs a good mopping - pickle slices on the floor, napkins all over, etc.

Menu is  very basic, and I would stick to the basic stuff..  Don't come in here looking for seafood unless you want breaded prawns ala Costco!  

The four of us had:
Bacon and eggs:  $9.95 - WTF???
Bacon cheeseburger served with frozen fries barely warm - $9;95
Cup of clam chowder - clearly out of a can - $4.95
Cup of minestrone - again, out of a can- $4.95

No crackers or bread offered with the soup and my dad's order of bacon and eggs was taken by another server and brought to her customer,, so he had to wait for his order a good ten minutes after we had ours. Not cool, especially since they didn't discount or offer us something in return for the error.

$43.85 for  party of four.   Far too expensive for very mediocre food.  Maybe it's time to give the lease to someone who will produce something far more palatable.

Final word on this:  fuck that shit.
author: .Hon H.

description:
TOURIST TRAP...It's too bad because I'm within walking distance of this place. Inconsistent service and mediocre food, at best. 

The spectacular view doesn't make up for the exorbitant prices either. Like another reviewer said, you're better off getting some grub up the block on Balboa or at a convenience store near the beach.
author: Art O.

description: Aww! Charming, old diner on the cliff. I get sentimental so I nearly cried reading the history and was a fan just because the story. Older crowd here with young staff mixed in. It is a tiny slightly stuffy dining space with typical diner food, but I wanted to go for the experience and I was craving a burger...and I got both with a view!
author: Jen T.

description: Amazing view of the pacific.. FOOD IS GREAT AND QUICK SERVICE.. A must to have breakfast with the locals.
author: Sneider M.

description:
OK, obviously it's a spectactular location. I rememembered average food and a nice quiet spot from my last visit about 6 years back. Today's experience was lousy enough to warrant one of my few yelps. 

Today: the noisiest place I'd ever been in, practically. A group was celebrating a birthday or anniversary and was so loud in that little room that the staff were actually complaining with disgusted looks on their faces to one another and to other customers about the noise, while barely out of earshot. Had the group heard, they probably would have been really offended.

I'd ordered a slice of tomato on my sandwich, when it came, it was four very thin slices of tomato (about 1/5 of a tomato, if I was to be generous) on its own plate with some lettuce that was so pale it was actually white (and tasted like plate). The portion of a tomato that was served tasted nice on my breakfast sandwich, but on the bill it appeared with the imperial price of $3.50.    I told my waitress it was "$3.50 too much to come back" but she offered no adjustment, nor much understanding.  OK, fine, decided to avoid in the future (unless I'm coming in strictly for the view)
author: steve e.

description:
This place is great for breakfast.  The apple smoked chicken sausage was awesome!

We only had to wait about 10 minutes to get a seat (it is a small place)
but we got to sit right by the window and had a great view!
author: M N.

description:
This restaurant is tough to review. On one hand they have the best location, having the best view ever of the Pacific Ocean, atop a cliff in Point Lobos. Amazing sunset views, a path down to go walking by the beach, I mean let's face it: it is breathtaking.
And boy do you pay for it! $2.35 for an unsweetened iced tea is shocking. $5 for a side plate of fries. Ridiculous. 
The wait staff are odd; in the sense that they are attentive, but we were served by 4 different people. And they're not all dressed as servers? I didn't get that, for a minute I thought some guy had just taken my friend's glass and walked away with it, only to return with a refill 30 seconds later.
Go for the view, not the food.
And, they're basically cash only.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
This is one of my favorite joints in SF.
The food is sooo good!!!

The milkshakes - amazing.
Burgers - huge and delicious.
Salads - out of this world. (I love the big Greek salad w chicken)
The breakfasts are so big.
And the views: GORGEOUS..

The servers are so wonderful to us every time we are there!!

We love Louis' !
author: Claudia B.

description:
Way overhyped.

Went there for lunch with 3 friends, and it was mediocre at best.  I ordered the friend scallops for $16.25, and expected some nice large and succulent scallops.  I got 8-10 teeny tiny scallops that were deep fried.  For that price, I'd been happy with 3-4 large mollusks.  Needless to say, I was sorely disappointed.  My friend like her burger, and the other friend's chicken nugget was delayed because they made the wrong item.  Go figure.  (I won't go back.)
author: Edward A.

description:
What someone else said about crappy seating service. I arrived with a friend and two hungry kids. Was told it would be a 20-25 minute wait, so my friend went outside with the kiddos to kill time. On the list ahead of me was a party of two, and after us (party of four) was another party of two.  A four-top and a two-top open up at the same time. What does the 16-year-old hostess with braces do? She put the party of two at the four-top, skipped over us, and seated the party of two after us, at the two-top. I asked her why she didn't put the party of two ahead of us at the two-top, so we could be seated, and she had absolutely no response.

Our waiter was chill, but responsive, but good-god the food is expensive. Really? $1.25 for EACH additional omelette ingredient (but seasonal spinach is $1.75).  The place has a great view, but give me a break.  If the food was exceptional, I might be okay with the prices, but it's basic diner food.  (Wanted to, but didn't get the $5.25 side of bacon. $5.25 for a side of bacon?!?  WTH? It's not even organic.)  The potatoes were dry toasted little cubes that had absolutely no flavor.  And no kids menu? Really?  Yeah, so my five-year-old had to order a $10 hamburger.

Meh, bleh.  I'm bummed, because I wanted it to be better.  Next time, we'll pack a lunch and sit outside overlooking the Sutro Baths.

(Hey, if someone at Louis' is reading this, you might want to check the trends on your customer reviews--they're taking a dive like a pelican into the ocean!)
author: Jen L.

description: Food was OK and the menu was limited, so I gave it 3 stars, despite a 5-star view of the Pacific Ocean, near the End of the World.  It was tiny, but quaint.  One bonus is Mark Zuckerberg sat in front of us one weekend.  That's San Francisco's version of royalty, so I guess it was worth it.
author: Gregory N.

description:
You go for the view, the diner experience hoping not to find a line too long.
It is worth anyway.
author: Luca R.

description:
This place was pretty packed when we went in, probably because it's the only nearby place to have lunch besides the Cliff House when you're hiking around Sutro. The wait for a table was well worth it though. The tuna melts we ordered were delicious, the view from the booth was picturesque, and the service was great. The place had a small town feel. The waitresses were really friendly, the atmosphere was casual, and the food was welcome comfort after a long day of exploring. There were a lot of hikers coming in to use the bathroom, which was right next to our booth, but they weren't too distracting and the staff was cool with it.

An unexpected side note to our visit was the presence of Robin Williams (yes, the actor), who was paying his bill as we were waiting to be seated. He seemed really comfortable and relaxed, the staff seemed really comfortable and relaxed, and my impression of the restaurant as a friendly down-home place was confirmed. I would defininely go back here on any visit to San Francisco.
author: Colleen D.

description: Only got a weird place at the 'bar' and were not allowed to move later. Burgers were soso, don't have to go again. The view is nice, as long as you don't face the kitchen.
author: Julie M.

description: Great location, beautiful view.  Amazing Milkshakes and Malts, you would think it would be a huge tourist spot but its actually not so bad, plus you can walk down to the baths before or after you eat for a nice walk.  Food is pretty mediocre, just dont have great expectations and you wont be short of happy.
author: Benjamin F.

description: I still have the aftertaste of the worst French fries I've had this year. My son said he was really disappointed, as the food's quality has fallen. Great place to get heartburn. And also expensive! Do not plan to come back.
author: Juan C, G.

description: If it was on view alone it would be a 5 - take away for poor service, poor food, and high prices. . . we get to one star. As a 4th gen SFer, I have only been here 3 times with out of towners and this was by far the worse. Last time was 25 years ago and it would have been a 3 star . . .
author: Abe N.

description:
Summary: You're paying for the view (which, by the way, you can get by stepping outside, although granted you won't be as warm and comfortable and won't have folks waiting on you.)

Went here with another after walking around Sutro Baths. Looked promising enough, but looks can be deceiving. Not that we were surprised that it was terribly expensive - the location and menu set in the window both speak volumes - but it's just that we were expecting so much more. The service was below average, the food was just okay, and even the view itself made the place seem plastic. Once I sat down and looked around, that's the precise feeling I got from the place: plastic. It's a very pretty establishment offering the standard but attractive diner fare that most people love. If you set it in the middle of Geary instead of teetering on a cliffside, people would never come (but of course, the prices would be a lot cheaper, too.)

I can't blame them for cashing in on what I am sure is a lucrative demographic and location. But at least try a little harder.

I had a veggieburger. One star is for that, and even that I could make better at home.
author: m r.

description: First of all, we had to wait for a booth for about 20-30 mins which wasn't that bad. The waitress who took our orders seemed friendly and the food didn't take long either. I ordered a veggie burger with fries! It looked good but nothing special...until I found a hair and a fly in my burger! We told the waitress and all she said was 'oh' then took the burger and didn't even say sorry nor offered anything else. We were shocked and when we got the bill it said that they charged half of the veggie burger with fries!! The least thing they could have done was not charging my veggie burger at all. Not a good experience!!!
author: Linda K.

description: This diner is located near the Sutro Baths. It was so lovely to see the waves crashing onto the rocks. The diner had many colored tiled floors, and the tables were small and close to each other. Also, counter space was available to sit in. This place seemed like it crowded with tourists or families giving tours to other friends. I had the Louis shrimp salad. The salad consisted of tomatoes, shrimp, and ranch dressing. I was shocked when I got it. There was so much shrimp and lettuce, I was unable to finish it. I suppose that's why they call it the Louis shrimp salad (their signature salad), it's not a shrimp!
author: Jennifer G.H. W.

description:
The service here is really 5 start worthy. The staff is EXTREMELY friendly and attentive. I really cannot rave enough about how wonderful all the girls who work here are. Really exceptional service. 
The place itself is pretty small and if it would have been any busier, I wouldn't have wanted to stay. Kind of a greasy spoon, but with gorgeous views. The food is very very very very BLAH. Nothing particularly good looking on the menu and all of it is very over priced. I settled for a bowl of chili which was just a can of hormel tossed into a bowl for $6.50.  My date ate an omelet that came with toast and hash browns but also cost $10.50.  I left full and happy with the service. But I could have just swung by the store and picked up some snacks to eat in a park and saved myself the money.
author: Jena D.

description: Always love this place! Great brunch yesterday. Excellent service and a can't beat the view from every table... One of the best price points with great quality. I highly recommend them....
author: Kimberly R.

description: Good Burgers, fair prices, Beautiful Ocean's view.
author: Andrea M.

description:
Pro:

(1) View. (!)
(2) Relaxed atmosphere.
(3) Cheaper than Cliff House.
(4) Feel of walking into a time warp.

Con:

Everything else.

Food is mediocre to bad. Cheese in omelettes is one notch above Velveeta. Hash browns are bland. Orange juice is from a juice concentrate machine. Waffles are one step above Eggo's.

Summary: Food is a little better than what I could make using packaged meals from the freezer, but the history and view saves this place from being an all-around bad experience. That's probably why they can remain in business with poor quality food.
author: M R.

description: Good red clam chowder, and turkey sandwich with bacon on sour dough.  Good fries too.   I'll be back.
author: Daniel A.

description:
Seriously, my SF must.
I still remember the first time my uncle brought us here, back in the early 90's. We sat by the windows, had their burgers and fries. It was the best meal ever.

I go back every time I am in the city, and I've brought many friends while I lived in the bay. The wait can be ridiculous from time to time, but I never complain, by the time you are sitting by the windows, you realize why everyone took their sweet time eating their food.

Their food is simple. Their tables and chairs are little outdated, but their service is very good, and looking at the photos on the walls can make the time to by so much faster.

Don't bring credit cards unless you want to use their atm machine at a fee.

I think I come back for the memories, their food takes me back to my childhood. Their service is still the same, don't be afraid to be seated next to strangers. That's the charming thing about this place.
author: S Y.

description:
We've only been here twice, but I'm looking forward to our next SF day trip so we can visit again.  My only complaint is that they close too early!   I can't think of a better, more affordable, casual place to watch the sunset over the ocean with my sweetie.  We typically don't go to diners, we're more sushi or Italian or French food people.  But after a day of walking around the city or the zoo or the beach, sometimes you just want a great bowl of chowder (without the hassle of the Wharf) and a cheeseburger or fish & chips!
Open - Open - Open!
author: Anna T.

description:
The food at Louis' isn't the best, but if I had to choose between going here for lunch or to Cliff House, I would choose here.  

The menu consists of typically American things like burgers, club sandwiches, and breakfast stuff; and to be honest, none of it is particularly mind blowing. 

However, the view is great, the prices are fair, and chances are the food won't kill you.  

PS: another plus is that the brunette waitress who works there is hot =P
author: Eric W.

description:
Love this place. Best for lunch... Had breakfast a few times but man their lunches are gooooood.

The Atmosphere:
It's a really small junky little shack hanging over the cliff but goddamn I love it here. The seats are huge and comfy, the tables are wide, and half the building consists of glass windows that look out to the ocean and the ruins of the original cliffhouse which used to be a bath house.

This place is a great spot to enjoy some incredible views while having an epic lunch. Plus it's not WAY EXPENSIVE like the cliffhouse just down the hill and the waiters/waitresses aren't rude either.

My two favorite things here are:

MINESTRONE SOUP!!!! zomgzorz
 I always get a bowl of this on a colder/rainy day and omg their minestrone is the BEST!!! It's thick and served hot with chunks of noodle and lots of veggies and herbs/spices. A bit salty but when you add in some pepper and fresh cheese it balances out just great. They also give you a side of amazingly fresh sourdough bread, sliced up and butter on the side to dip into your soup.

My other favorite choice is this sandwich, think it's turkey and bacon but what seals the deal is that they serve it on a huge sourdough roll. I am a massive fan of sourdough bread and this bread is fantastic! It has a leathery-like crust, golden brown and then the inside is fluffly, soft, and warm. It's the best sourdough bread I can find next to Boudines and it actually tastes quite similar. The veggies on this bad boy are fresh and crisp and so is the meat and cheese. 

In fact, any sandwich you can get here, get it on the sourdough bread, cuz I think that's what just makes it.

My only dislike is that the bathroom is a nightmare. LOL.... it's so small the door barely closes and then you're trapped inside a coffin. But hey! The foods great and the service is nice so it all works out.

CASH ONLY!!! BRING CASH... or you will have to run down to the cliff house and use their atm and then run back up.
author: Gina S.

description:
This place is fucking cute. I got to sit at a booth overlooking the sutro baths, and the ocean on a clear and pretty day.

That alone is worth coming back for.

but the food was pretty delicious here! i just got a standard breakfast for me, grilled cheese bacon and hashbrowns. yum!

A tad pricey, but really yummy...and did I mention the view!?
author: Lauren S.

description:
Nothing like being 8 months pregnant and hungry in the midst of a 6 mile beach walk, to have Louis's as a solid option for re-fueling before the walk back home. 

We arrived at about 7:45 am, the place was getting busy. We settled into the cushy ocean view booth and enjoyed a full breakfast, listening to christmas classics for under $25 - 2 people. I had the chili cheese omelet. It was the perfect cozy meal to warm me up. A pretty good deal for $10.75 - cheese omelet (I think they use velveeta, which normally I wouldn't touch, but HEY I'm preggers so anything goes...and what a treat!) covered in homemade chili, hashbrowns (also something I normally don't eat) and 2 english muffins w/tangy orange marmalade. The restaurant was clean as usual and filled with cute local families, couples and a few tourists. 

Usually I get their milkshakes too which are sooooo good, old school served with the 'xtra' stainless steel serving. 

The service here is always always friendly. The servers are always smiling. 

Last weekend we ate at the Bistro, had the same marmalde, same view (albeit better quality food) at over double the final tab. 

My only complaint....they don't ever say 'good bye' when we leave, even if I say 'thank you' as I open the door to leave. Maybe they are pre-occupied but I always like to be acknowledged when I leave a restaurant for some reason, just the same as entering. Kind of 'seals the deal' in a sense. 

This place is what is is...an old school no frills diner. You should come here with this in mind otherwise, go to the fancier bistro at the cliff house down the street.

*Cash only
author: Amy E.

description:
A very basic run of the mill cafe from the 70's.  Their menu is from the 70's, the decor, their outfits, mugs, cups, plates............all are very ordinary.  70's menu with 2010 prices. 

Menu is very boring.  2 types of salads. House and Shrimp Louis.  3 types of soups. basic breakfast menu with some dinner entrees.  The only thing new about this place is their view.  Cliff house, Sutro and the trail were newly renovated and looked great.  

Come here only if it's not cloudy and that you don't mind eating very average food.  Great for tourists!!!
author: jason g.

description: Friendly staff and awesome view. If you don't want to pay double for the same view and grub, this little family owned spot is worth it.
author: Dee H.

description: So so food, fake home fries. Price is so high it's not worth the wait or the food...
author: Jeff H.

description:
A diner which started in 1937 and the exterior and interior of it looks like it's that old.  Still family owned but now by the 2nd generation brothers who both graduated from the popular Hotel & Restaurant program at CCSF in the 1970's.  The waitresses at breakfast were all young.  I asked if they were all college students, she told me they were all college grads with the exception of one.  

Beats being a janitor.  Hub's co-worker spent $120K for his son's 4 yr. college education.  The kid graduated this past June with a degree in Humanities.  Even 'tho it only took him 4 mos to find a job, he's a currently working as a janitor at a zoo.  

The food here is not too dissimilar from the food at a diner we visited in the Tenderloin recently.  Most breakfasts were about $9-$10 or more.  My over-easy eggs were cooked just right, served with packaged hash browns and wheat toast.  We had a view of the ocean but it was too overcast to see much.  Hubby had the standard frozen packaged sausage links, muffin, hash browns & eggs.

Maybe on a clear day where you can see forever will it be worth a trip here but I wouldn't necessarily return for their breakfast menu.  CASH only.
author: Ry T.

description: Stopped here while wanting to check out the ocean.  Unfortunately it was extremely foggy so we couldn't see a thing.  Fortunately Louis' was there to take care of us.  Good food .... Good service.  I would definitely come back.  Hopefully next time it won't be as foggy so that I can take advantage of the amazing view that I can tell this place offers.
author: Marc L.

description:
Actually this place used to be one of favorite Sunday brunch places. However for the last two times I have been here, I left heart broken. The staff used to be young and friendly, now they are just young :( 
I will give a date and time so that if the management reads this they can take action. Today is July 18 12:30 pm. The hostess was horrible. We asked for a fork, she grab one and told us that was the last one. We were puzzled and then she started eating her food !!!! Really. Thank god the waitress was nice and she went back found a plastic fork. 
 Not sure if I will ever come back here.
author: Ismail S.

description: Inexpensive classic American breakfast and lunch food with views to kill for. Louis' is one of SF's best kept secrets.
author: Matt C.

description: Love it, great view. Although this seems like a place for regulars, we were seated at a table and I guess when the regular person who sat there came in, they weren't very pleased to see us sitting there. Great potatoes here, had the eggs benedict and could not finish I was so full. Staff is friendly and nice, looks like a family place. It's a nice place to start off your day and walk to the beach.
author: Kimberly S.

description: My parents first took me here when I was a kid.  It's a nice cozy place to relax and have breakfast (good breakfast too).   Back when I was a kid (80's) I remember their was a waitress, a much older lady, she was so friendly and energetic (I believe she was Louis herself).  My Family and I still come here on special occasions, I am definitely happy to see that it's still in business and not taken over by any Yuppies.  I really do hope that it stays in business for a long time, it's definitely one of San Francisco's most hidden treasures!!
author: Carolina M.

description: The view, the view, the view.  Two of us $40, including tip - which is VERY high for a diner.  We both got sandwiches, and they came on super fresh sourdough bread.  The sandwiches themselves were nothing special, but the bread was really good.  Service was good.  We got there just before the lunch rush, and only waited about 5 minutes.  We ended up with the best seat in the house - the corner booth with windows all around us.  That is what made it worth it.  Perfect start or end to the Land's End hike.  Don't expect anything special, but a perfectly fine diner.
author: Shelby B.

description:
Been here twice.  The first time I went with a friend for lunch and all was good.  The second time I went with the soon to be in-laws and things were not so good.  The service definitely left something to be desired - we felt like we were bothering the waitress when we asked for more coffee.  

The food is regular greasy spoon fare.  It's cash only, so bring your dollars and your pretty pennies.  There is an ATM outside though.

The view is freakin' AWESOME.  If I go back again, I'm definitely waiting for that booth in the corner.
author: Godzilla T.

description: A really cute little diner with an amazing view! Overlooking the Sutro Bath ruins and the ocean makes this place a popular little tourist trap.
author: Mike P.

description:
the view the view the view.....it's all about being right above sutro baths and the ocean. 

the pancakes are a tad rubbery and my dining companions grated style hash browns were barely beige, but the bacon was GREAT. 

1 coffee, 1 order 2 eggs w/toast & hash browns, 1 short stack & a side o' delicious bacon, total damage $19 and change. That's useful, right?
author: Gwynnie P.

description: Comfort food, great views, old school. I don't like having to pay with cash.
author: Paula H.

description: I was looking forward to a nice cheeseburger, while visiting the city from Texas.  I should have known they couldn't possibly measure up to the fantastic fair available in Dallas, but wasn't prepared for the absolutely terrible burger served to me.  The bun was a grocery store version, you know, from an 8-pack, small, nothing special.  The menu says 1/3 pound, but what came out was a lot smaller, meaning the meat was probably 70/30 or 80/20 before cooking.  No taste.  Beef for burgers should be 85/15 for best taste.  The lettuce was a piece of iceberg from the bottom area of the head. At $10.50, the lettuce should be at least a large dark green piece of leaf lettuce, the bun should be specialty bread, and the meat should be full of flavor.  The crinkle-cut fries were obviously the bagged frozen kind and unremarkable.  The view is, obviously, the only thing to come here for.  The waitstaff mostly ignored us during the meal.  AND, the cash only policy is definitely antiquated!
author: Janelle H.

description: Mediocre food.  Not-so-friendly hostess, decent server, excellent view.  I'd go back there strictly for the view.
author: Terri M.

description:
Louis' has good food and a great view.  Very much a tourist spot but my dad loves their waffles so I go here with my parents.  I usually get the eggs benedict and coffee, they make a pretty good cup of coffee.

I would say good breakfast, not amazing, and better lunch.  They make really good minestrone soup and burgers. 

Louis' has been around for years and is family run.  Nice staff and you can usually get in and out pretty quick.  A lot of times there is a wait list on weekends, but they move through that usually in about 15-20 minutes or so and you can always walk up to the lookout point and little gift shop which is fun.  

A little on the pricey side but they are definitely a tourist spot so you can't blame them.

I like this place a lot, it is a pretty usual family spot for us and fun to bring friends and family when they are in town.
author: Jessie M.

description:
this is one of the best finds for us - we thoroughly enjoyed our breakfast and the view is awsome! say hi to Mr. Leon. the drive in from the city is totally worth it. take the coastal drive.
cheers!
author: Dave C.

description: I went here on a Monday at about 2:00.  I waited less than 3 min for a table.  The service was excellent.  I had the fried scallops which maybe were a little overpriced but were worth it for the view and were very tasty.  While you are in the neighborhood, take a hike by all means.  I recommend making going to this place a "day trip".
author: Linda L.

description:
I have not come to San Francisco once without making sure at least one early morning breakfast was spent looking out over the coast and cliffs  astride Ocean Beach.  This diner, family-owned and operated since 1937 puts together food that is so delicious and homemade tasting that it actually manages to distract (just a bit) from the view.

Pancakes, omelettes, french toast, fried eggs, coffee, pie... it's all as you'd expect at the diner of your dreams.  The service is fast and west-coast-friendly with just a little bit of east-coast-sass.  

Sadly, they are closing down for a couple of months (at the end of November) for some major renovations.  I'm crushed... Without a major miracle, on my next trip here, I'm going to have to find somewhere new to crunch through slabs of yummy bacon and watch the waves crash below. 

Even from across the country, I'll miss this place while it's closed, and look forward to seeing it reopen in the spring.  It's a delight here, and hope it keeps its old-school feeling of warmth and welcoming when it comes back.
author: Ryan H.

description: My first visit since their remoldeling. Took a few friends who are visiting from back east. We all ordered breakfast items even though it was lunch time. Come to think of it, think I have never had anything but breakfast here. They did a nice job on the remodeling, and are now accessible. Food was good, views are always amazing, and staff was, as always, friendly. Not the cheapest place, but the views make it worth every penny. Welcome back to a San Francisco classif.
author: Ranger A.

description:
Local diner with a view.  I hope Louis' stays forever because it's part of my San Francisco and when I come back to visit, I want it to be there and not see a Starbucks in its place.

Friendly service, people who know and remember you and treat you right.

All your diner favorites are here, from egg breakfasts to burgers and short-order items.

My suggestion?  Come here for breakfast before you take the dogs for a run down Ocean Beach! :)
author: Justin C.

description:
Louis' is still a great little spot for diner style food. Burgers are delicious, especially the chili cheese burger. Very satisfying. Pies are good too! I recommend the berry pies. Place is small, but if you can get a window seat the views are sweeping. 

Prices are moderate to a little high. Keep in mind tourists are around. But the food is pretty good and the atmosphere easy-going and friendly. Service is good too! 

They don't take credit cards, so bring cash. After your meal take time to walk around the newly built walkway and landing at Point Lobos. The view at sunset is worth it. 

And, there are also new walk ways along the back of the Cliff House. A good view of Seal Rock can be seen from there. Yet if you go there on a foggy or windy day, dress warm. It can get cold.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
This place has easily one of the best views of any restaurant / diner on the planet. If you're lucky enough to get the corner booth you'll have panoramic views and on clear days you can see the Farallon Islands. I really enjoyed grabbing a sandwich while watching several ships go by.

The food is A-OK for a diner, they have a decent selection of grilled sandwiches and the burgers are good. In the past I've had a milk shake here and I can remember it being really good.

In my opinion this place is a must if you have guests in town, although I think group sizes should be kept to 4 and under due to limited space here. Louis' could be your reward after hiking the Land's End Trail (another must for guests to the city).
author: Bryan B.

description:
Obviously the reason to come here is that you came to the seacliff but don't want to shell out the extra money for an expensive lunch at the Cliff House. 

The food really isn't all that bad, but the the prices are a little high for a diner. I have definitely had worse! However, the view and the very nice staff should count for something.

So if you want to enjoy decent food, great views and friendly people this is your place. Or maybe you're just cheap and hungry.
author: Ryan V.

description:
Breakfast with a View...  I actually thought the prices were going to be even more than they were but it was about right for an Old San Francisco Breakfast Dive Spot with a view.  

Their food was okay but not the best breakfast I've had nor the cheapest.  The ham omelette I ordered was $9.50 and it came with breakfast potatoes and an English Muffin.  The omelette was good but my potatoes came out too mushy.  And the English muffin was very run of the mill.  My wife got the Sausage and Eggs Breakfast and that was about $8.50.  She thought it was okay and agreed that my omelette was the best thing we ended up trying...

The coffee was a little steep at $2.25 a pop but whenever you go to a place with a view, expect a markup.  But Refills are included with the price so it's all good.    

All in all, the portions were very generous and I would come back here to enjoy the view on a nice day but this would certainly not be my "regular" breakfast spot...
author: Mark W.

description:
My family and I have returned to this spot my entire life. It's like a time capsule - and I'm not just talking about the 70s tile and curtains. The food OK and it closes pretty early, but nothing can beat the view. You can throw down a hundred bucks on dinner for two at the beach chalet to watch the sunset, but it is NOT necessary, because Louis is just up the hill and has them beat.  
It's great for a casual outing - especially when family is in town, and the walk through the old Sutro bath house or the park is a plus. It is a corner of the city worth exploring.
author: Martina R.

description:
Location and View are the primary reasons for coming  to this officially-designated National Park concessionaire. Yes, it has a the feeling of a traditional diner, and the food is average, and the menu is somewhat limited compared to other SF diners. But, the wait staff are nice and the view from the window seats are terrific!

Food is more expensive than expected and credit cards not accepted, but there is an ATM on-site.
author: MandS R.

description: The view is great. The burger is pretty good. The 45+ minute wait at the door is horrible. Fuddy Duddy, slow people linger long after they finish at the few tables. Not worth the wait for ok diner food. The view is better at the free Lands End visitor center a few steps away with benches and a parking lot.
author: Peter C.

description:
We called in sick one sunny autumn day and ran around the city in our sleep-deprived state. What began the night before, we did not wish to end, and so we continued on. It was a beautiful day to be enjoyed together. After soaking in the morning sun and breathing in the cool, crisp ocean air by the Cliff House and Sutro Baths, we ate at Louis'. 

It's a friendly spot. Food is mediocre. Nothing special, but if you sit back and stare out the window at the ocean, you can enjoy the view and perhaps overhear interesting conversation in the next booth over. The waitstaff are kind and will humor their patrons and listen to their crazy stories.

I had always thought that Louis' was a fancy schmancy restaurant because of its prime location. Little did I know, it's just a diner. Well, a diner with a history and a view.
author: Tinna H.

description:
I live not too far from this place and I've always avoided it because it's location just reek's tourist trap. However, every place should get a real chance, and I was glad we tried it out. It's very small, but nearly every table has a wonderful view. There is also a counter if you're in a hurry. We were informed by the nice hostess that we only had to wait 20 minutes for a window seat, and that's how long it took to get a nice booth next to a window overlooking the Sutro Baths. 

You'd think that's where the good news ends, but, I was pleasantly surprised by good service, and a decent chili size. (I'm dinging them a little for not cooking it medium rare, but medium well). My "date" had a fried egg sandwich that was scrumptious. And, my Anchor Steam in a bottle was ICE cold. Come to think of it, I'd give them 4.5 if I could. I think I'll return to try their breakfast, which is apparently served all day.
author: Rich M.

description:
Five stars for the hash browns and the view! A great local favorite.

Note: breakfast (hash browns) served all day, pancakes and french toast until 12 noon, and waffles until 2 pm.

Name is pronounced LOU-eez.
author: Charlene C.

description:
A group of 6 of us went to Louis' Restaurant on the edge of the Richmond district.  The restaurant overlooks the beach, Seal Rock, the Sutro Baths and the Cliff House.  There was a 15 minute wait mid-morning on a Sunday.

Our plates were typical standard dine fare.  Notable items were the bacon which was thick and lean, the chili omelette which took an entire plate, and the hash browns which were big in portion.  If you are going to have an A-ok meal, why not top it off with a ton of hash browns?  Everything else was pretty good.  

This place can't help but be a tourist trap with its magnificent view.  There is a pathway down to the Sutro Baths behind the diner - be careful of its steep drop.  3 stars for the food, 4 stars for being kid-friendly and having a great view on a sunny day!
author: Janet H.

description: Solid coveted 5 stars. The view is unbeatable and the fact that you can have a malt milkshake at 8am is a throwback to 24/7 Diners. This is the real deal. Eggs Benny plus pancakes and you're set. If you're like me and you're a big dude, then I recommend sitting at the tables and not the booth. The booths are made for little elven people. You know the Christmas-y kind.
author: Jon H.

description:
Not the best, not the worst...this is pretty standard breakfast grub. They have a counter, a pay on the way out register and several varieties of mints and gums, qualifying this a a diner, but barely since the feel is much more touristy.  

What it does have going for it is a good view and the option of ordering a cheeseburger at 7AM when you are hungover and that just sounds so much better than eggs.
author: Drue C.

description:
Many of the locals wouldn't think to come to Louis': that's where all the tourists go!  Not us.  Today, one of the most beautiful days of the year, there were available tables, and, in the small lot across the street (NO METERS, & we're in San Francisco???) the parking gods smiled over us with karma and granted a selection of choice spots to park.  

This is the place to go, if you have no pretensions, and you want a decent burger cooked the way you want.  With unlimited refills on the soda, and super, super, staff (today it was Patty), this was the most relaxing, fun, family dinner in ages.  

Every staff member we talked with were so courteous,so nice, not phony.  One family member had a generous caesar salad, another had a bacon burger.  

Free parking, a very attentive, friendly staff, great food at a price reasonable in an expensive urban area.  What more could you want???  Oh, did I mention the view???  

Instant vacation.  Thank you Louis' you made my day!  Look forward to our next visit. 

PS  We forgot that this is a cash only restaurant.  They conveniently have an ATM inside the restaurant.  With many banks cancelling the ATM fees, this was not a problem.
author: F M.

description:
My BF and I walked over to a local restaurant called Louis' Restaurant. It's a small diner looking over the Sutro Baths in the Outer Richmond District. The views are awesome, the people are great, and the food is pretty tasty. We sat by the window (most of the seats line the window so every spot has a great view), ordered a cheeseburger (for me) and a bacon omelet with hash browns (for Greg). Both were very good! They even serve our new favorite beer, Anchor Steam! This is a spot we will be returning to (especially on those hungover mornings!)

One Tip: Cash Only (there is an ATM there)

Check out some of our other favorite spots, pics, and reviews on our blog http://www.sanfrancisconoobs.com/
author: Casi C.

description:
Great diner.  Great views.  Friendly staff.  Good food.  Bring cash.  

This place is a classic.  Perfect after a day of exploring Sutro Baths or Lands End.  I like to hike from the Legion of Honor, through the backwoods, along the coast, and end up back at Louis, where we have a nice meal.  It's mostly downhill the entire route.  Then, if we're lazy, we hop on the 18 bus and let it take us back to where we left the car at the Legion.
author: Sebastian S.

description:
A spectacular view supplemented by average food. Of course the price includes the view. You want a bargain, pack a lunch and try not to get blown away while you sit on the rocks. 

I like the idea that the same family has owned the place since 1937. Putting it out to bid doesn't mean the food will be any better or the prices will go any lower. As a matter of fact, the exact opposite is likely to happen. This little dot on the Pacific coast is cozy. 

I like the atmosphere. Grab a booth (the booth seats are worn from thousands of contented butts sliding in and out) , grab a table, grab a counter stool. I didn't come here for fancy chef school fare. I came here for some warm, filling, decent food. That's exactly what I got. 

You want fancy and overpriced? Go a stones throw away to Cliff House. 

Cash only and the ATM is right inside the door.
author: Bada B.

description:
Woke up early in the morning to go search for a breakfast place. This place was amazing. i personally think the food here is great! i ordered the EGG and BACON. The pancakes here are huge. 

If you want some good breakfast, this is the place to go to. Go a little bit early, it can get pretty packed up sometimes.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Love breakfast. Like eating here. Food is great, don't get me wrong. But sometimes I feel like it's a bit overpriced for the selection. I'm sure we're paying for the views but I definitely know there's better quality elsewhere. 

The service is great and they try to get you to a table as quickly as possible.  When a line does form, hopefully it'll be just a few minutes. But I have had to wait, willingly, for half an hour or so. But you just never know. 

Lots of parking on the street or across the street. After breakfast, take a nice walk to the beach or through the baths to work that omelette off.
author: Maria B.

description: Wonderful view, obviously. But I am disappointed, especially since I heard so many wonderful things about how good they were going to be after the renovation. It was better beforehand. Truth be told - and it's perhaps a marginal difference - the food is better at the Seal Rock restaurant up the street from Louis'. Add to that the fact that Seal Rock has a better menu and takes credit cards, and I have to wonder why I would bother waiting to eat at Louis'. If you get that northwest corner booth though, it's worth it.
author: Steven P.

description:
It was a cold, windy Saturday, a typical summer day in San Francisco.  I wanted to feel more cheerful, and I thought of lunch at Louis'.  We walked up Ocean Beach to get there, and enjoyed looking at the rolling surf.  There's nothing more calming than an hour or two watching the ocean, no matter what state it's in.  We stepped into Louis' and found the place half empty.  This was 4:30 pm on Saturday in the summer!  We were seated in ten minutes, at a table in one of the large picture windows that wrap around the whole building.  

I had been picturing a shrimp salad sandwich since I thought of Louis' earlier in the day.  They didn't have that, but they did have a large shrimp louis salad, with sourdough bread on the side.  That and a Coke satisfied me that day.  The shrimp was tender, tasty, cooked just right.  The louis dressing was served on the side, but I poured the whole thing on my salad.  Margaret had a house salad, which she said was delicious, deep-fried shrimp, which I verified were delicious, french fries, and mineral water.   We enjoyed a leisurely meal, watching people explore the ruins of the Sutro Baths below, and watching fishermen on the rocks offshore.  The surf was high, and the waves hitting the rocks splashed above the fishermen's heads.  Lots of birds flew by; it looked like the water between the baths and Seal Rocks was a regular flyway.  There was a lot to watch, and no hurry to leave.  

Nothing much seems to have changed here since the place opened in 1937, except maybe the price.  In constant dollars, I wonder if even that has changed.  Our meal cost us $34, plus the tip.  

What a great way to spend the day!
author: David D.

description:
We recently entertained some toddlers. We took them to Louis'. Here is what they say, and I quote:

A 5 year old girl:
"The food was good. It was as good as can be."

A 7 year old girl:
"It had a great view and I could see a lot. I could see the waves splash. I could see people down below by the waves. It looked so fun I wanted to play. I loved the shrimp cocktail. My mom ordered it and I sat and waited. My friends sat across the table and had a yummy hamburger and grilled ham and cheese."

(5 stars determined by the above mini-yelpers.)
author: Derek B.

description:
This diner has a great view over the Sutro Baths and the Pacific Ocean.  The booths near the windows in the back are the very best.

The food is good, and I have had the chili, the grilled cheese sandwich and a few other things.  They also have great pies for dessert.  The bathrooms are comical.  During busy times, there may be a short wait.
author: Ryan W.

description:
Grilled Cheese.  French Fries.  Shakes.  (or, if it's cold)  Hot Cocoa.  

Louis' fits the bill every time.  

I think we should encourage all tourists to go down the hill to the Cliff House, so we can keep Louis' a secret just for us.
author: Hannah Lee H.

description:
We went here for the first time last weekend for lunch.  It was good, not great.  As with many other reviews you'll read on this place, you pay for the view which last Saturday was amazing.  

It was busy and I'm assuming mostly with tourists.  I have nothing against tourists, they spend a lot of money in this town so keep them coming.  But tourists can tempt a place to be mediocre so I'm wary.  That is not the case here.

The staff was very friendly and prompt.  Thumbs up there.  And there are a lot of people working for such a small place.  

The food we had is good, not great but good.  

Sutro sandwich with Swiss rather than Monterey Jack.  The thing that made this sandwich better than a simple ham, turkey and cheese was that the roll was warm.  What a huge difference.  Fries were probably from the freezer which surprised me being the restaurant has a long write up on its menu about fresh organic locally sourced ingredients.  They are just fries but it does make me wonder what else isn't fresh.

Spinach Salad was good and lightly dressed which was a plus.  Came with warm sourdough.

Lastly Fish'n Chips was good.  

They serve a Manhattan clam chowder which is nice to see for a change.  It was OK.  Grandma made the best so hard to compete.

Nothing great but all of it good.  And yes all of it more expensive than it would be if the place was in Daily City but you do pay for that view as I'm sure the restaurant pays for its location.  Don't complain about having to spend a couple extra dollars for the view and the history of this place.

Based on what I've read, I'm going to have to come here for breakfast.  

If you're a local or just visiting head on over, especially if it's a sunny day.
author: Mike H.

description:
Best spot for crappy hot chocolate in the whole wide world.
Rachael forever.
author: Jonny A.

description:
Louis Louis Louis.
If stars were ambiance, you would have them all. This place was last remodeled in '75. How do I know? The fluorescent yellow paired with pea green tiles is a bit of an indicator - but no, they boast this little tid-bit on their menu. Along with a bunch of other dis-jointed shit that you just HAVE to know about the family that started and still runs this place.

I love the history, Louis has got that down y'all. 

However.

I don't enjoy a bread-plate sized iceberg & romaine salad with 1 slice of tomato and 5 boxed croutons. Call me picky. I just don't feel like I should have to guard my coveted 1 slice of tomato. What if I should go to cut it and it slides detrimentally right off the plate, queuing sad sad Charlie Brown music as it plunges to that orange, brown, green and fluorescent yellow sea of tiles? 
No, that would just be too depressing for words.

I ate what I would of the salad, still excited at the notion that I had me some fried scallops on the way. Never had a fried scallop. Never had a scallop I didn't like either, and WHO has ever had a fried food that they didn't enjoy to the end? Who? Show me.

Limp fries and golden discs of seafood were then set in front of me. These were BATTERED scallops. Not what I was expecting, for some reason - but a treat just the same. I don't know a soul who would be full off of this "meal" (besides my size 0 cousin who can drink coffee and be good to go until dinner), but it worked out as a nice appetizer for the largest salad that I could stuff into that bio-degradable paper box from Whole Foods that I ran to after and ate the shit out of.

Louis is one of those places that you just have to go to. You know that you will have better food elsewhere, better surroundings - but you won't get that fresh-from-the sea old tymey historic feeling that you will from Ol Louis. 
Just go. Maybe eat before...
But when you do, bring all your cash. This plate don't take kindly to tha plastic. And they got Anchor Steam. Yeah, you'll need your cash to get your fill of that!
author: Katie W.

description: Ok diner food, ok prices and service. Unbeatable view, my eyes were stuck on the sutro bath ruins during sunset so concentrating on eating was difficult.
author: Carlos L.

description: The hostess blew it for us before we even sat down. We waited 45 min as we were told. We checked in 5 min before the 45 min and were told we had 1 table in front of us. We waited outside, where everyone was waiting. She comes out and calls us, when we walked in--right away, I see she had moved down the list in that 15 seconds and sat someone else down. Then I said, you just called us. She knew she screwed us, I can see she felt bad, but how about waiting for us to walk in? She spoke with some other lady, and came back to say "sorry, we'll seat you next".  We waited 20 more minutes.  Not cool. It's the third time I've been here. The food is ok. But service is a big part of what customers pay for. And that is poor service. I can't remember if the food was good, bc it tasted bad in my mind.
author: M K.

description:
Ahhh, the loveliness of Louis'.  This cozy cliff-dwelling cafe has been run by the same family since the 1930's, and is one of the best places for a great view of Seal Rocks and beyond.  

Great burgers, yummy breakfasts, lots of comfort foods, but what really brings me here are the shakes.  They are really fantastic -- best are the chocolate or coffee.  

Try going during non-peak hours to avoid a wait -- plenty of street parking, or use the lot just up the hill a ways.  

It has tiny tables, closely spaced, so isn't ideal for groups -- better to just grab a friend and go.  

Although the restaurant is wheelchair accessible, the bathrooms are microscopic and would be hard/impossible to maneuver with a wheelchair.
author: Bevy M.

description:
Hamburger and egg, right there together on the same plate with a cup of joe and a large OJ?  I've gone a lot further for a lot less.  Unbeatable view where in one amazing meal we saw whales, dolphins, and seals?  Now we're talking.  Listening to my 8-year old tell the missus all about the Sutro Baths while we looked at the ruins with the waves crashing on it? Your mileage may vary, but that's a home run.
